Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-310.1(2)(d)(viii): 76-5-405 aggravated sexual assault under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-310.1(2)(e): involves the smuggling of 10 or more individuals.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-310.1(3): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-310.1(4): Aggravated human smuggling is a separate offense from any other crime committed in relationship to the offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311 Human trafficking of a vulnerable adult -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(1): 76-5-111(1); 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(1)(a): 76-5-111(1) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(1)(a)(i): "Commercial sexual activity with a vulnerable adult" means any sexual act with a vulnerable adult for which anything of value is given to or received by any individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(1)(a)(ii): 76-5-111(1) "Vulnerable adult" means the same as that term is defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(2): An actor commits human trafficking of a vulnerable adult if the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(2)(a): recruits, harbors, transports, or obtains a vulnerable adult for sexual exploitation or forced labor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(2)(b): patronizes or solicits a vulnerable adult for sexual exploitation or forced labor when the actor knew or should have known of the victim's vulnerability.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(3): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4): 76-5-308
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4)(a): 76-5-308 Human trafficking of a vulnerable adult for labor includes any labor obtained through force, fraud, or coercion as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4)(b): Human trafficking of a vulnerable adult for sexual exploitation includes all forms of commercial sexual activity with a vulnerable adult involving:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4)(b)(i): sexually explicit performances;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4)(b)(ii): prostitution;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4)(b)(iii): participation in the production of pornography;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4)(b)(iv): performance in a strip club; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-311(4)(b)(v): exotic dancing or display.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401 Unlawful sexual activity with a minor -- Penalties -- Evidence of age raised by defendant -- Limitations.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(1): (2); 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(1)(a): (2) As used in this section, "minor" means an individual who is 14 years old or older, but younger than 16 years old, at the time the sexual activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(2)(a)(i): has sexual intercourse with the minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(2)(a)(ii): engages in any sexual act with the minor involving the genitals of an individual and the mouth or anus of another individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(2)(a)(iii): causes the penetration, however slight, of the genital or anal opening of the minor by a foreign object, substance, instrument, or device, including a part of the human body, with the intent to cause substantial emotional or bodily pain to any individual or with the intent to arouse or gratify the sexual desire of any individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(2)(b): (2)(a)(ii) Any touching, however slight, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(3)(b)(i): (3)(a); (c) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i); 77-41-102(18)(a)(vii) An offense under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401(3)(c)(ii): (3)(c)(i); 77-41-102(18)(a)(vii) An offense under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1 Sexual abuse of a minor -- Penalties -- Limitations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1): (2); 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(a): (2) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(a)(i): "Indecent liberties" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(a)(i)(A): the actor touching another individual's genitals, anus, buttocks, pubic area, or female breast;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(a)(i)(B): causing any part of an individual's body to touch the actor's or another's genitals, pubic area, anus, buttocks, or female breast;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(a)(i)(C): simulating or pretending to engage in sexual intercourse with another individual, including genital-genital, oral-genital, anal-genital, or oral-anal intercourse; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(a)(i)(D): causing an individual to simulate or pretend to engage in sexual intercourse with the actor or another, including genital-genital, oral-genital, anal-genital, or oral-anal intercourse.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(a)(ii): (2) "Minor" means an individual who is 14 years old or older, but younger than 16 years old, at the time the sexual activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2): (4); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2)(a): (4) Under circumstances not amounting to an offense listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2)(a)(i): is four years or more older than the minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2)(a)(ii): with the intent to cause substantial emotional or bodily pain to any individual, or with the intent to arouse or gratify the sexual desire of any individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2)(a)(ii)(A): touches the anus, buttocks, pubic area, or any part of the genitals of the minor;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2)(a)(ii)(B): touches the breast of a female minor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2)(a)(ii)(C): otherwise takes indecent liberties with the minor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(2)(b): (2)(a) Any touching, even if accomplished through clothing, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(3): (2)(a); 77-41-102(18)(a)(viii) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(3)(a): a class A misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(3)(b): 77-41-102(18)(a)(viii) not subject to registration under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(4): (2)(a); 76-5-401; 76-5-402; 76-5-402.2; 76-5-403; 76-5-405; (4)(a); (e) The offenses referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(4)(a): 76-5-401 unlawful sexual activity with a minor, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(4)(b): 76-5-402 rape, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(4)(c): 76-5-402.2 object rape, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(4)(d): 76-5-403 forcible sodomy, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(4)(e): 76-5-405 aggravated sexual assault, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.1(4)(f): (4)(a); (e) an attempt to commit an offense listed in Subsections

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3 Unlawful adolescent sexual activity -- Penalties -- Limitations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(1): 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(1)(a): As used in this section, "adolescent" means an individual in the transitional phase of human physical and psychological growth and development between childhood and adulthood who is 12 years old or older, but younger than 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(2): (4) Under circumstances not amounting to an offense listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(2)(a): is an adolescent; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(2)(b): has sexual activity with another adolescent.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(a): third degree felony if an actor who is 17 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 12 or 13 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(b): third degree felony if an actor who is 16 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 12 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(c): class A misdemeanor if an actor who is 16 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 13 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(d): class A misdemeanor if an actor who is 14 or 15 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 12 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(e): class B misdemeanor if an actor who is 17 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 14 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(f): class B misdemeanor if an actor who is 15 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 13 years old;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(g): class C misdemeanor if an actor who is 12 or 13 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 12 or 13 years old; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(3)(h): class C misdemeanor if an actor who is 14 years old engages in unlawful adolescent sexual activity with an adolescent who is 13 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4): (2); 76-5-402; 76-5-402.1; 76-5-402.2; 76-5-402.3; 76-5-403; 76-5-403.1; 76-5-404; 76-5-405; 76-7-102; (4)(a); (4)(i) The offenses referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(a): 76-5-402 rape, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(b): 76-5-402.1 rape of a child, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(c): 76-5-402.2 object rape, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(d): 76-5-402.3 object rape of a child, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(e): 76-5-403 forcible sodomy, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(f): 76-5-403.1 sodomy on a child, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(g): 76-5-404 sexual abuse of a child, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(h): 76-5-405 aggravated sexual assault, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(i): 76-7-102 incest, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(4)(j): (4)(a); (4)(i) an attempt to commit any offense listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(5): 80-6-303.5; 80-6-902 An offense under this section is not eligible for a nonjudicial adjustment under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(6): 80-6-504 Except for an offense that is transferred to a district court by the juvenile court in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-401.3(7): 77-41-102(18) An offense under this section is not subject to registration under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402 Rape -- Penalties.
-------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(1): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(2)(a): An actor commits rape if the actor has sexual intercourse with another individual without the individual's consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(2)(b): (2)(a) Any sexual penetration, however slight, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(2)(c): This section applies whether or not the actor is married to the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(3): (2); (3)(b); (c); (3)(c); (4) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(3)(a): (3)(b); (c) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(3)(b): (3)(c); (4) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(3)(b)(i): during the course of the commission of the rape the defendant caused serious bodily injury to the victim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(3)(b)(ii): at the time of the commission of the rape, the defendant was younger than 18 years old and was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(3)(c): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that at the time of the commission of the rape the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(4): (3)(b); (3)(b) If, when imposing a sentence under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(4)(a): 10 years and which may be for life; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(4)(b): six years and which may be for life.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(5): (4); (3)(a); (c) The provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402(6): (3)(b); (3)(c); (4); 76-3-406 Imprisonment under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1 Rape of a child -- Penalties.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(1): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(2)(a): An actor commits rape of a child if the actor has sexual intercourse with an individual who is younger than 14 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(2)(b): (2)(a) Any touching, however slight, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(3): (2); (3) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(3)(a): (3) except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(3)(b): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(3)(b)(i): during the course of the commission of the rape of a child, the defendant caused serious bodily injury to the victim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(3)(b)(ii): at the time of the commission of the rape of a child the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(4): (3) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5): (3); (5); (3); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(a): (3); (5); (3) When imposing a sentence under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(a)(i): it is a first time offense for the defendant under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(a)(ii): the defendant was younger than 21 years old at the time of the offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(a)(iii): (3) the court finds that a lesser term than the term described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(b): (5) If the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(b)(i): 15 years and which may be for life;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(b)(ii): 10 years and which may be for life; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(5)(b)(iii): six years and which may be for life.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.1(6): 76-3-406 Imprisonment under this section is mandatory in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2 Object rape -- Penalties.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(1): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2): (2)(a)(i) An actor commits object rape if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a): the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(i): acts without an individual's consent;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(ii): causes the penetration, however slight, of the genital or anal opening of the individual by:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(ii)(A): a foreign object;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(ii)(B): a substance;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(ii)(C): an instrument;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(ii)(D): a device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(ii)(E): a part of the human body other than the mouth or genitals; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(iii)(A): intends to cause substantial emotional or bodily pain to the individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(a)(iii)(B): intends to arouse or gratify the sexual desire of any individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(2)(b): (2)(a)(i) the individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(3): (2); (3); (3) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(3)(a): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(3)(b): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(3)(b)(i): during the course of the commission of the object rape the defendant caused serious bodily injury to the victim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(3)(b)(ii): at the time of the commission of the object rape, the defendant was younger than 18 years old and was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(3)(c): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that at the time of the commission of the object rape, the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(4): (3); (3) If, when imposing a sentence under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(4)(a): 10 years and which may be for life; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(4)(b): six years and which may be for life.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(5): (4); (3) The provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.2(6): (3)(b); (3)(c); (4); 76-3-406 Imprisonment under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.3(2): (2)(b); (2)(a)(i); (2)(a)

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.3(3)(a)(ii): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-402.3(3)(a)(ii)(A): during the course of the commission of the object rape of a child the defendant caused serious bodily injury to the victim; or

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403 Forcible sodomy -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(1): 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(1)(a): As used in this section, "sodomy" means engaging in any sexual act with an individual who is 14 years old or older involving the genitals of one individual and the mouth or anus of another individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(2)(a): An actor commits forcible sodomy when the actor commits sodomy upon another individual without the other individual's consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(2)(b): (2)(a) Any touching, however slight, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(3): (2); (3)(b); (c); (3)(c); (4) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(3)(a): (3)(b); (c) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(3)(b): (3)(c); (4) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(3)(b)(i): during the course of the commission of the forcible sodomy the defendant caused serious bodily injury to the victim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(3)(b)(ii): at the time of the commission of the rape, the defendant was younger than 18 years old and was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(3)(c): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that at the time of the commission of the forcible sodomy the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(4): (3)(b); (3)(b) If, when imposing a sentence under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(4)(a): 10 years and which may be for life; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(4)(b): six years and which may be for life.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(5): (4); (3)(a); (c) The provisions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403(6): (3)(b); (3)(c); (4); 76-3-406 Imprisonment under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1 Sodomy on a child -- Penalties.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(1): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(2)(a): An actor commits sodomy on a child if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(2)(a)(i): the actor engages in any sexual act upon or with another individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(2)(a)(ii): the individual is younger than 14 years old; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(2)(a)(iii): the sexual act involves the genitals or anus of the actor or the individual and the mouth or anus of either the actor or individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(2)(b): (2)(a) Any touching, even if accomplished through clothing, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(3): (2)(a); (3) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(3)(a): (3) except as provided in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(3)(b): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(3)(b)(i): during the course of the commission of the sodomy on a child the defendant caused serious bodily injury to the victim; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(3)(b)(ii): at the time of the commission of the sodomy on a child, the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(4): (3) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5): (3); (5); (3); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(a): (3); (5); (3) When imposing a sentence under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(a)(i): it is a first time offense for the defendant under this section;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(a)(ii): the defendant was younger than 21 years old at the time of the offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(a)(iii): (3) the court finds that a lesser term than the term described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(b): (5) If the conditions of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(b)(i): 15 years and which may be for life;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(b)(ii): 10 years and which may be for life; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(5)(b)(iii): six years and which may be for life.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-403.1(6): 76-3-406 Imprisonment under this section is mandatory in accordance with Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(2)(a)(i): without the consent of the individual, the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(2)(a)(i)(A): touches the anus, buttocks, pubic area, or any part of the genitals of another individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(2)(a)(i)(B): touches the breast of another individual who is female; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(2)(a)(i)(C): otherwise takes indecent liberties with another individual;

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(3)(a): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(3)(b): (3)(a); (3)(b)(ii); (2); (3)(b)(i); (3)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(3)(b)(i): (3)(a); (3)(b)(ii); (2) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(3)(b)(ii): (3)(b)(i); (3)(b)(i) If, when imposing a sentence under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404(3)(b)(ii)(A): 10 years and which may be for life; or

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1 Sexual abuse of a child -- Penalties -- Limitations.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1): 76-5-401.1; (1)(a)(iv)(A); (V); 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a): 76-5-401.1; (1)(a)(iv)(A); (V) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(i): "Adult" means an individual 18 years old or older.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(ii): "Child" means an individual younger than 14 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iii): 76-5-401.1 "Indecent liberties" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv): (1)(a)(iv)(A); (V) "Position of special trust" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(A): an adoptive parent;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(B): an athletic manager who is an adult;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(C): an aunt;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(D): a babysitter;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(E): a coach;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(F): a cohabitant of a parent if the cohabitant is an adult;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(G): a counselor;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(H): a doctor or physician;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(I): an employer;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(J): a foster parent;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(K): a grandparent;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(L): a legal guardian;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(M): a natural parent;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(N): a recreational leader who is an adult;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(O): a religious leader;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(P): a sibling or a stepsibling who is an adult;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(Q): a scout leader who is an adult;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(R): a stepparent;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(S): a teacher or any other individual employed by or volunteering at a public or private elementary school or secondary school, and who is 18 years old or older;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(T): an instructor, professor, or teaching assistant at a public or private institution of higher education;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(U): an uncle;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(V): a youth leader who is an adult; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(a)(iv)(W): (1)(a)(iv)(A); (V) any individual in a position of authority, other than those individuals listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2): (4); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a): (4) Under circumstances not amounting to an offense listed in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a)(i)(A): touches the anus, buttocks, pubic area, or genitalia of any child;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a)(i)(B): touches the breast of a female child; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a)(i)(C): otherwise takes indecent liberties with a child; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a)(ii): the actor's conduct is with intent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a)(ii)(A): cause substantial emotional or bodily pain to any individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(a)(ii)(B): to arouse or gratify the sexual desire of any individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(2)(b): (2)(a) Any touching, even if accomplished through clothing, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(3): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(4): (2)(a); 76-5-402.1; 76-5-402.3; 76-5-403.1; (4)(a); (4)(c) The offenses referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(4)(a): 76-5-402.1 rape of a child, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(4)(b): 76-5-402.3 object rape of a child, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(4)(c): 76-5-403.1 sodomy on a child, in violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(4)(d): (4)(a); (4)(c) an attempt to commit an offense listed in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.1(5): 76-3-406 Imprisonment under this section is mandatory in accordance with Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3 Aggravated sexual abuse of a child -- Penalties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(1): 76-5-404.1; 76-5-404.1; 76-5-404.1; 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(1)(a): 76-5-404.1; 76-5-404.1; 76-5-404.1 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(1)(a)(i): 76-5-404.1 "Adult" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(1)(a)(ii): 76-5-404.1 "Child" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(1)(a)(iii): 76-5-404.1 "Position of special trust" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2): 76-5-404.1(2)(a); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a): 76-5-404.1(2)(a) An actor commits aggravated sexual abuse of a child if, in conjunction with the offense described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(i): the actor committed the offense:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(i)(A): by the use of a dangerous weapon;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(i)(B): by force, duress, violence, intimidation, coercion, menace, or threat of harm; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(i)(C): during the course of a kidnaping;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(ii): the actor caused bodily injury or severe psychological injury to the child during or as a result of the offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(iii): the actor was a stranger to the child or made friends with the child for the purpose of committing the offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(iv): the actor used, showed, or displayed pornography or caused the child to be photographed in a lewd condition during the course of the offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(v): the actor, prior to sentencing for this offense, was previously convicted of any sexual offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(vi): the actor committed the same or similar sexual act upon two or more individuals at the same time or during the same course of conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(vii): the actor committed, in Utah or elsewhere, more than five separate acts, which if committed in Utah would constitute an offense described in this chapter, and were committed at the same time, or during the same course of conduct, or before or after the instant offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(viii): the actor occupied a position of special trust in relation to the child;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(ix): the actor encouraged, aided, allowed, or benefitted from acts of prostitution or sexual acts by the child with any other individual, sexual performance by the child before any other individual, human trafficking, or human smuggling; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(a)(x): the actor caused the penetration, however slight, of the genital or anal opening of the child by any part or parts of the human body other than the genitals or mouth.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(2)(b): (2)(a) Any touching, even if accomplished through clothing, is sufficient to constitute the relevant element of a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(3): (6); (2); (3)(b); (3)(c); (4); (3)(c); (4) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(3)(a): (3)(b); (3)(c); (4) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(3)(b): (3)(c); (4) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-404.3(3)(c): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that at the time of the commission of the aggravated sexual abuse of a child, the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405 Aggravated sexual assault -- Penalty.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(1): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2): An actor commits aggravated sexual assault if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(a): in the course of a rape, object rape, forcible sodomy, or forcible sexual abuse, the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(a)(i): uses, or threatens another individual with the use of, a dangerous weapon;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(a)(ii): compels, or attempts to compel, another individual to submit to rape, object rape, forcible sodomy, or forcible sexual abuse, by threat of kidnaping, death, or serious bodily injury to be inflicted imminently on any individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(a)(iii): is aided or abetted by one or more persons;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(b): in the course of an attempted rape, attempted object rape, or attempted forcible sodomy, the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(b)(i): causes serious bodily injury to any individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(b)(ii): uses, or threatens the individual with the use of a dangerous weapon;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(b)(iii): attempts to compel the individual to submit to rape, object rape, or forcible sodomy, by threat of kidnaping, death, or serious bodily injury to be inflicted imminently on any individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(b)(iv): is aided or abetted by one or more persons; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(c): in the course of an attempted forcible sexual abuse, the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(c)(i): causes serious bodily injury to any individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(c)(ii): uses, or threatens the individual with the use of a dangerous weapon;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(c)(iii): attempts to compel the individual to submit to forcible sexual abuse, by threat of kidnaping, death, or serious bodily injury to be inflicted imminently on any individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(2)(c)(iv): is aided or abetted by one or more persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3): (2); (2); (3); (2); (3); (2); (3) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(a): (2); (3) for an aggravated sexual assault described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(a)(i): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(a)(ii): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that at the time of the commission of the aggravated sexual assault, the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(b): (2); (3) for an aggravated sexual assault described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(b)(i): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(b)(ii): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that at the time of the commission of the aggravated sexual assault, the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(c): (2); (3) for an aggravated sexual assault described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(c)(i): (3) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(3)(c)(ii): life without parole, if the trier of fact finds that at the time of the commission of the aggravated sexual assault, the defendant was previously convicted of a grievous sexual offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-405(4): (3); (3); (4); (3)

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406 Sexual offenses against the victim without consent of victim -- Circumstances.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(1)(a): "Health professional" means an individual who is licensed or who holds the individual out to be licensed, or who otherwise provides professional physical or mental health services, diagnosis, treatment, or counseling, including an athletic trainer, physician, osteopathic physician, physician assistant, nurse, dentist, physical therapist, chiropractor, mental health therapist, social service worker, clinical social worker, certified social worker, marriage and family therapist, professional counselor, psychiatrist, psychologist, psychiatric mental health nurse specialist, or substance abuse counselor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(1)(b): "Religious counselor" means a minister, priest, rabbi, bishop, or other recognized member of the clergy.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(1)(c): "To retaliate" includes threats of physical force, kidnapping, or extortion.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2): 76-5-404.1; (2)(b); (d) An act of sexual intercourse, rape, attempted rape, rape of a child, attempted rape of a child, object rape, attempted object rape, object rape of a child, attempted object rape of a child, forcible sodomy, attempted forcible sodomy, sodomy on a child, attempted sodomy on a child, forcible sexual abuse, attempted forcible sexual abuse, sexual abuse of a child, attempted sexual abuse of a child, aggravated sexual abuse of a child, attempted aggravated sexual abuse of a child, or simple sexual abuse is without consent of the victim under any of the following circumstances:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(a): the victim expresses lack of consent through words or conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(b): the actor overcomes the victim through the actual application of physical force or violence;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(c): the actor is able to overcome the victim through concealment or by the element of surprise;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(d): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(d)(i): the actor coerces the victim to submit by threatening to retaliate in the immediate future against the victim or any other person, and the victim perceives at the time that the actor has the ability to execute this threat; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(d)(ii): the actor coerces the victim to submit by threatening to retaliate in the future against the victim or any other person, and the victim believes at the time that the actor has the ability to execute this threat;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(e): the actor knows the victim is unconscious, unaware that the act is occurring, or is physically unable to resist;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(f): the actor knows or reasonably should know that the victim has a mental disease or defect, which renders the victim unable to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(f)(i): appraise the nature of the act;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(f)(ii): resist the act;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(f)(iii): understand the possible consequences to the victim's health or safety; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(f)(iv): appraise the nature of the relationship between the actor and the victim;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(g): the actor knows that the victim participates because the victim erroneously believes that the actor is someone else;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(h): the actor intentionally impaired the power of the victim to appraise or control his or her conduct by administering any substance without the victim's knowledge;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(i): the victim is younger than 14 years of age;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(j): 76-5-404.1 the victim is younger than 18 years of age and at the time of the offense the actor was the victim's parent, stepparent, adoptive parent, or legal guardian or occupied a position of special trust in relation to the victim as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(k): (2)(b); (d) the victim is 14 years of age or older, but younger than 18 years of age, and the actor is more than three years older than the victim and entices or coerces the victim to submit or participate, under circumstances not amounting to the force or threat required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(2)(l): the actor is a health professional or religious counselor, the act is committed under the guise of providing professional diagnosis, counseling, or treatment, and at the time of the act the victim reasonably believed that the act was for medically or professionally appropriate diagnosis, counseling, or treatment to the extent that resistance by the victim could not reasonably be expected to have been manifested.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406(3): Consent to any sexual act or prior consensual activity between or with any party does not necessarily constitute consent to any other sexual act. Consent may be initially given but may be withdrawn through words or conduct at any time prior to or during sexual activity.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.3 Applicability of sentencing provisions.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person convicted of a violation of SectionUtah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.3(1): If the person is sentenced prior to April 29, 1996, he shall be sentenced in accordance with the statutory provisions in effect prior to that date.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.3(2): If the person commits the crime and is sentenced on or after April 29, 1996, he shall be punished in accordance with the statutory provisions in effect after April 29, 1996.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.3(3): 77-27-9(2)(a); (b) If the person commits the crime prior to April 29, 1996, but is sentenced on or after April 29, 1996, he shall be given the option prior to sentencing to proceed either under the law which was in effect at the time the offense was committed or the law which was in effect at the time of sentencing.  If the person refuses to select, the court shall sentence the person in accordance with the law in effect at the time of sentencing.  The provisions of Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5 Circumstances required for probation or suspension of sentence for certain sex offenses against a child.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1): 76-5-402.1; 76-5-402.3; 76-5-403.1; 76-5-404.3; Part 4, Sexual Offenses; (3); (3) In a case involving a conviction for a violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(a): the defendant did not use a weapon, force, violence, substantial duress or menace, or threat of harm, in committing the offense or before or after committing the offense, in an attempt to frighten the child victim or keep the child victim from reporting the offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(b): the defendant did not cause bodily injury to the child victim during or as a result of the offense and did not cause the child victim severe psychological harm;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(c): the defendant, prior to the offense, had not been convicted of any public offense in Utah or elsewhere involving sexual misconduct in the commission of the offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(d): Part 4, Sexual Offenses the defendant did not commit an offense described in this
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(e): the defendant did not use, show, or display pornography or create sexually-related photographs or tape recordings in the course of the offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(f): the defendant did not act in concert with another offender during the offense or knowingly commit the offense in the presence of a person other than the victim or with lewd intent to reveal the offense to another;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(g): the defendant did not encourage, aid, allow, or benefit from any act of prostitution or sexual act by the child victim with any other person or sexual performance by the child victim before any other person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(h): (3) the defendant admits the offense of which he has been convicted and has been accepted for mental health treatment in a residential sexual abuse treatment center that has been approved by the Department of Corrections under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(i): (3) rehabilitation of the defendant through treatment is probable, based upon evidence provided by a treatment professional who has been approved by the Department of Corrections under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(j): prior to being sentenced, the defendant has undergone a complete psychological evaluation conducted by a professional approved by the Department of Corrections and:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(j)(i): the professional's opinion is that the defendant is not an exclusive pedophile and does not present an immediate and present danger to the community if released on probation and placed in a residential sexual abuse treatment center; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(j)(ii): the court accepts the opinion of the professional;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(k): if the offense is committed by a parent, stepparent, adoptive parent, or legal guardian of the child victim, the defendant shall, in addition to establishing all other conditions of this section, establish it is in the child victim's best interest that the defendant not be imprisoned, by presenting evidence provided by a treatment professional who:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(k)(i): is treating the child victim and understands he will be treating the family as a whole; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(k)(ii): has assessed the child victim for purposes of treatment as ordered by the court based on a showing of good cause; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(1)(l): if probation is imposed, the defendant, as a condition of probation, may not reside in a home where children younger than 18 years old reside for at least one year beginning with the commencement of treatment, and may not again take up residency in a home where children younger than 18 years old reside during the period of probation until allowed to do so by order of the court.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(2): (3) A term of incarceration of at least 90 days is to be served prior to treatment and continue until the time when bed space is available at a residential sexual abuse treatment center as provided under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(3)(a): The Department of Corrections shall develop qualification criteria for the approval of the sexual abuse treatment programs and professionals under this section.  The criteria shall include the screening criteria employed by the department for sexual offenders.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(3)(b): The sexual abuse treatment program shall be at least one year in duration, shall be residential, and shall specifically address the sexual conduct for which the defendant was convicted.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(4): 76-3-406 Establishment by the defendant of all the criteria of this section does not mandate the granting under this section of probation or modification of the sentence that would otherwise be imposed by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(4)(a): the nature, frequency, and duration of the conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(4)(b): the effects of the conduct on any child victim involved;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(4)(c): the best interest of the public and any child victim; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(4)(d): the characteristics of the defendant, including any risk the defendant presents to the public and specifically to children.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(5): The defendant has the burden to establish by a preponderance of evidence eligibility under all of the criteria of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(6): If the court finds a defendant granted probation under this section fails to cooperate or succeed in treatment or violates probation to any substantial degree, the sentence previously imposed for the offense shall be immediately executed.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(7): The court shall enter written findings of fact regarding the conditions established by the defendant that justify the granting of probation under this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-406.5(8): (1); (1); (8) In cases involving conviction of any sexual offense against a child other than those offenses provided in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-407 Consensual conduct in marriage.
--------------------------------------------------------------
The provisions of this part do not apply to consensual conduct between individuals married to each other.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-409 Corroboration of admission by child's statement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-409(1): Notwithstanding any provision of law requiring corroboration of admissions or confessions, and notwithstanding any prohibition of hearsay evidence, a child's statement indicating in any manner the occurrence of the sexual offense involving the child is sufficient corroboration of the admission or the confession regardless of whether or not the child is available to testify regarding the offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-409(2): (1) A child, for purposes of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-410 Child victim of sexual abuse as competent witness.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A child victim of sexual abuse under the age of 10 is a competent witness and shall be allowed to testify without prior qualification in any judicial proceeding.  The trier of fact shall determine the weight and credibility of the testimony.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-412.2 Custodial sexual misconduct -- Penalties -- Defenses.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-412.2(1): 76-5-412; 76-5-401.1; 76-5-412; 76-5-412; 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-412.2(1)(a): 76-5-412; 76-5-401.1; 76-5-412; 76-5-412 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-412.2(1)(a)(i): 76-5-412 "Actor" means the same as that term is defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-412.2(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-412.2(2)(a): (2)(b); 76-5-412(4) An actor commits custodial sexual misconduct if:

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-414 Child conceived as a result of sexual offense -- Custody and parent-time.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-414(1): Title 76, Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses; 76-5-401; 76-5-401.2 A person convicted of a violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-414(1)(a): the nonconvicted biological parent or legal guardian of the child consents and the court determines it is in the best interest of the child to award custody or parent-time to the convicted person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-414(1)(b): after the date of the conviction, the biological parents cohabit and establish a mutual custodial environment for the child.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-414(2): A denial of custody or parent-time under this section may not in and of itself:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-414(2)(a): terminate the parental rights of the person denied parent-time or custody; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-414(2)(b): affect the obligation of the convicted person to financially support the child.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-415 Educator's license subject to action for violation of this part.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Commission of any offense under this

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701 Female genital mutilation definition.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(1): As used in this part, "female genital mutilation" means any procedure that involves partial or total removal of the external female genitalia, or any harmful procedure to the female genitalia, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(1)(a): clitoridectomy;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(1)(b): the partial or total removal of the clitoris or the prepuce;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(1)(c): excision or the partial or total removal of the clitoris and the labia minora, with or without excision of the labia majora;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(1)(d): infibulation or the narrowing of the vaginal orifice with the creation of a covering seal by cutting and appositioning the labia minora or the labia majora, with or without excision of the clitoris;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(1)(e): pricking, piercing, incising, or scraping, and cauterizing the genital area; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(1)(f): any other actions intended to alter the structure or function of the female genitalia for non-medical reasons.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-701(2): 80-2-602 Female genital mutilation is considered a form of child abuse for mandatory reporting under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702 Prohibition on female genital mutilation -- Exceptions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(1): 76-1-101.5; 76-5-701 Terms defined in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(2): 76-5-701; 76-5-701; 76-5-701 An actor commits female genital mutilation if the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(2)(a): 76-5-701 performs a procedure described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(2)(b): 76-5-701 gives permission for or permits a procedure described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(2)(c): 76-5-701 removes or causes, permits, or facilitates the removal of a female under 18 years old from this state for the purpose of facilitating the performance of a procedure described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(3): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(4): 76-5-701 It is not a defense to this section that the conduct described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(5): A surgical procedure is not a violation of this section if the procedure is performed by a physician licensed as a medical professional in the place it is performed and the procedure is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(5)(a): medically advisable;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(5)(b): necessary to preserve or protect the physical health of the individual on whom it is performed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(5)(c): requested for sex reassignment surgery by the individual on whom it is performed.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-702(6): Title 58, Chapter 31b, Nurse Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 67, Utah Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 68, Utah Osteopathic Medical Practice Act; Title 58, Chapter 70a, Utah Physician Assistant Act The license of any medical professional licensed in accordance with


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703 Community education program.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(1): The director of the Department of Health shall develop a community education program regarding female genital mutilation.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2): 80-2-602 The program shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2)(a): education, prevention, and outreach materials regarding the health risks and emotional trauma inflicted by the practice of female genital mutilation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2)(b): ways to develop and disseminate information regarding recognizing the risk factors associated with female genital mutilation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2)(c): 80-2-602 training materials for law enforcement, teachers, and others who are mandated reporters under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2)(c)(i): risk factors associated with female genital mutilation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2)(c)(ii): signs that an individual may be a victim of female genital mutilation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2)(c)(iii): best practices for responses to victims of female genital mutilation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-703(2)(c)(iv): the criminal penalties associated with the facilitation or commission of female genital mutilation.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704 Civil cause of action.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704(1): An individual upon whom female genital mutilation was performed may bring a civil action in any court of competent jurisdiction for female genital mutilation any time within 10 years of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704(1)(a): the procedure being performed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704(1)(b): the victim's 18th birthday.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704(2): The court may award actual, compensatory, and punitive damages, and any other appropriate relief.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704(3): A prevailing plaintiff shall be awarded attorney fees and costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704(4): Treble damages may be awarded if the plaintiff proves the defendant's acts were willful and malicious.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5-704(5): 76-5-702; 78B-3-416 If a health care provider is charged and prosecuted for a violation of Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 76 - Chapter 5b - Sexual Exploitation Act
*********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Sexual Exploitation Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102 Legislative determinations -- Purpose of chapter.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102(1): The Legislature of Utah determines that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102(1)(a): the sexual exploitation of a minor is excessively harmful to the minor's physiological, emotional, social, and mental development;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102(1)(b): the sexual exploitation of a vulnerable adult who lacks the capacity to consent to sexual exploitation can result in excessive harm to the vulnerable adult's physiological, emotional, and social well-being;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102(1)(c): a minor cannot intelligently and knowingly consent to sexual exploitation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102(1)(d): regardless of whether it is classified as legally obscene, material that sexually exploits a minor, or a vulnerable adult who does not have the capacity to consent to sexual exploitation, is not protected by the First Amendment of the United States Constitution or by the First or Fifteenth sections of Article I of the Utah Constitution and may be prohibited; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102(1)(e): prohibition of and punishment for the distribution, possession, possession with intent to distribute, and production of materials that sexually exploit a minor, or a vulnerable adult who lacks the capacity to consent to sexual exploitation, is necessary and justified to eliminate the market for those materials and to reduce the harm to the minor or vulnerable adult inherent in the perpetuation of the record of the minor's or vulnerable adult's sexually exploitive activities.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-102(2): It is the purpose of this chapter to prohibit the production, possession, possession with intent to distribute, and distribution of materials that sexually exploit a minor, or a vulnerable adult who lacks capacity to consent to sexual exploitation, regardless of whether the materials are classified as legally obscene.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(1): "Child sexual abuse material" means any visual depiction, including any live performance, photograph, film, video, picture, or computer or computer-generated image or picture, whether made or produced by electronic, mechanical, or other means, of sexually explicit conduct, where:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(1)(a): the production of the visual depiction involves the use of a minor engaging in sexually explicit conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(1)(b): the visual depiction is of a minor engaging in sexually explicit conduct; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(1)(c): the visual depiction has been created, adapted, or modified to appear that an identifiable minor is engaging in sexually explicit conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(2): "Distribute" means the selling, exhibiting, displaying, wholesaling, retailing, providing, giving, granting admission to, or otherwise transferring or presenting child sexual abuse material or vulnerable adult sexual abuse material with or without consideration.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(3): "Identifiable minor" means a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(3)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(3)(a)(i): who was a minor at the time the visual depiction was created, adapted, or modified; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(3)(a)(ii): whose image as a minor was used in creating, adapting, or modifying the visual depiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(3)(b): who is recognizable as an actual person by the person's face, likeness, or other distinguishing characteristic, such as a birthmark, or other recognizable feature.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(4): "Identifiable vulnerable adult" means a person:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(4)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(4)(a)(i): who was a vulnerable adult at the time the visual depiction was created, adapted, or modified; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(4)(a)(ii): whose image as a vulnerable adult was used in creating, adapting, or modifying the visual depiction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(4)(b): who is recognizable as an actual person by the person's face, likeness, or other distinguishing characteristic, such as a birthmark, or other recognizable feature.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(5): 76-5-111.4 "Lacks capacity to consent" is as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(6): "Live performance" means any act, play, dance, pantomime, song, or other activity performed by live actors in person.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(7): "Minor" means a person younger than 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(8): "Nudity or partial nudity" means any state of dress or undress in which the human genitals, pubic region, buttocks, or the female breast, at a point below the top of the areola, is less than completely and opaquely covered.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(9): "Produce" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(9)(a): the photographing, filming, taping, directing, producing, creating, designing, or composing of child sexual abuse material or vulnerable adult sexual abuse material; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(9)(b): the securing or hiring of persons to engage in the photographing, filming, taping, directing, producing, creating, designing, or composing of child sexual abuse material or vulnerable adult sexual abuse material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10): "Sexually explicit conduct" means actual or simulated:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(a): sexual intercourse, including genital-genital, oral-genital, anal-genital, or oral-anal, whether between persons of the same or opposite sex;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(b): masturbation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(c): bestiality;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(d): sadistic or masochistic activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(e): lascivious exhibition of the genitals, pubic region, buttocks, or female breast of any person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(f): the visual depiction of nudity or partial nudity for the purpose of causing sexual arousal of any person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(g): the fondling or touching of the genitals, pubic region, buttocks, or female breast; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(10)(h): the explicit representation of the defecation or urination functions.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(11): "Simulated sexually explicit conduct" means a feigned or pretended act of sexually explicit conduct which duplicates, within the perception of an average person, the appearance of an actual act of sexually explicit conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(12): 76-5-111(1) "Vulnerable adult" is as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(13): "Vulnerable adult sexual abuse material" means any visual depiction, including any live performance, photograph, film, video, picture, or computer or computer-generated image or picture, whether made or produced by electronic, mechanical, or other means, of sexually explicit conduct, where:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(13)(a): the production of the visual depiction involves the use of a vulnerable adult engaging in sexually explicit conduct;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(13)(b): the visual depiction is of a vulnerable adult engaging in sexually explicit conduct; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-103(13)(c): the visual depiction has been created, adapted, or modified to appear that an identifiable vulnerable adult is engaging in sexually explicit conduct.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201 Sexual exploitation of a minor -- Offenses.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(1): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(2): An actor commits sexual exploitation of a minor when the actor knowingly possesses or intentionally views child sexual abuse material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(3): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(3)(a): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(3)(b): It is a separate offense under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(3)(b)(i): for each minor depicted in the child sexual abuse material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(3)(b)(ii): for each time the same minor is depicted in different child sexual abuse material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4): Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4)(a): It is an affirmative defense to a charge of violating this section that no minor was actually depicted in the visual depiction or used in producing or advertising the visual depiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4)(b): Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses For a charge of violating this section, it is an affirmative defense that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4)(b)(i): the defendant:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4)(b)(i)(A): did not solicit the child sexual abuse material from the minor depicted in the child sexual abuse material;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4)(b)(i)(B): is not more than two years older than the minor depicted in the child sexual abuse material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4)(b)(i)(C): upon request of a law enforcement agent or the minor depicted in the child sexual abuse material, removes from an electronic device or destroys the child sexual abuse material and all copies of the child sexual abuse material in the defendant's possession; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(4)(b)(ii): Chapter 5, Part 4, Sexual Offenses the child sexual abuse material does not depict an offense under
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(5): In proving a violation of this section in relation to an identifiable minor, proof of the actual identity of the identifiable minor is not required.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6): 77-4-201 The following are not criminally or civilly liable under this section when acting in good faith compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(a): an entity or an employee, director, officer, or agent of an entity when acting within the scope of employment, for the good faith performance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(a)(i): reporting or data preservation duties required under federal or state law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(a)(ii): implementing a policy of attempting to prevent the presence of child sexual abuse material on tangible or intangible property, or of detecting and reporting the presence of child sexual abuse material on the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(b): a law enforcement officer acting within the scope of a criminal investigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(c): an employee of a court who may be required to view child sexual abuse material during the course of and within the scope of the employee's employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(d): a juror who may be required to view child sexual abuse material during the course of the individual's service as a juror;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(e): an attorney or employee of an attorney who is required to view child sexual abuse material during the course of a judicial process and while acting within the scope of employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(f): an employee of the Department of Health and Human Services who is required to view child sexual abuse material within the scope of the employee's employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201(6)(g): an attorney who is required to view child sexual abuse material within the scope of the attorney's responsibility to represent the Department of Health and Human Services, including the divisions and offices within the Department of Health and Human Services.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1 Aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(1): 80-1-102; 76-1-101.5 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(1)(a): 80-1-102 "Physical abuse" or "physically abused" means the same as the term "physical abuse" is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 The terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(2): (2)(a); (b); 76-5b-201 An actor commits aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor if the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(2)(a): intentionally distributes child sexual abuse material;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(2)(b): knowingly produces child sexual abuse material; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(2)(c): (2)(a); (b); 76-5b-201 is the minor's parent or legal guardian and knowingly consents to or permits the minor to be sexually exploited as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(3): (3)(b); (c); (2); (2); (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(3)(a): (3)(b); (c); (2) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(3)(b): (2) If an actor is under 18 years old at the time of the offense, a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(3)(c): (2)(a) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(3)(c)(i): 14 years old or older; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(3)(c)(ii): pubescent.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(4): It is a separate offense under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(4)(a): for each minor depicted in the child sexual abuse material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(4)(b): for each time the same minor is depicted in different child sexual abuse material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(5)(a): It is an affirmative defense to a charge of violating this section that no minor was actually depicted in the visual depiction or used in producing or advertising the visual depiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(5)(b): In proving a violation of this section in relation to an identifiable minor, proof of the actual identity of the identifiable minor is not required.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6): 77-4-201 The following are not criminally or civilly liable under this section when acting in good faith compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(a): an entity or an employee, director, officer, or agent of an entity when acting within the scope of employment, for the good faith performance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(a)(i): reporting or data preservation duties required under federal or state law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(a)(ii): implementing a policy of attempting to prevent the presence of child sexual abuse material on tangible or intangible property, or of detecting and reporting the presence of child sexual abuse material on the property;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(b): a law enforcement officer acting within the scope of a criminal investigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(c): an employee of a court who may be required to view child sexual abuse material during the course of and within the scope of the employee's employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(d): a juror who may be required to view child sexual abuse material during the course of the individual's service as a juror;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(e): an attorney or employee of an attorney who is required to view child sexual abuse material during the course of a judicial process and while acting within the scope of employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(f): an employee of the Department of Health and Human Services who is required to view child sexual abuse material within the scope of the employee's employment; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-201.1(6)(g): an attorney who is required to view child sexual abuse material within the scope of the attorney's responsibility to represent the Department of Health and Human Services, including the divisions and offices within the Department of Health and Human Services.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202 Sexual exploitation of a vulnerable adult -- Offenses.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(1): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(2): (2)(a); (2)(a) An actor commits sexual exploitation of a vulnerable adult if the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(2)(a): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(2)(a)(i): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(2)(a)(i)(A): knowingly produces, possesses, or possesses with intent to distribute material that the actor knows is vulnerable adult sexual abuse material; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(2)(a)(i)(B): intentionally distributes or views material that the actor knows is vulnerable adult sexual abuse material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(2)(a)(ii): (2)(a) the vulnerable adult who appears in, or is depicted in, the vulnerable adult sexual abuse material lacks capacity to consent to the conduct described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(2)(b): (2)(a) is a vulnerable adult's legal guardian and knowingly consents to, or permits the vulnerable adult to be, sexually exploited as described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(3): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(3)(a): (2) A violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(3)(b): It is a separate offense under this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(3)(b)(i): for each vulnerable adult depicted in the vulnerable adult sexual abuse material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(3)(b)(ii): for each time the same vulnerable adult is depicted in different vulnerable adult sexual abuse material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(4): It is an affirmative defense to a charge of violating this section that no vulnerable adult was actually depicted in the visual depiction or used in producing or advertising the visual depiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(5): In proving a violation of this section in relation to an identifiable vulnerable adult, proof of the actual identity of the identifiable vulnerable adult is not required.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(6): This section may not be construed to impose criminal or civil liability on:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(6)(a): any entity or an employee, director, officer, or agent of an entity, when acting within the scope of employment, for the good faith performance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(6)(a)(i): reporting or data preservation duties required under any federal or state law; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(6)(a)(ii): implementing a policy of attempting to prevent the presence of vulnerable adult sexual abuse material on any tangible or intangible property, or of detecting and reporting the presence of vulnerable adult sexual abuse material on the property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-202(6)(b): any law enforcement officer acting within the scope of a criminal investigation.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203 Distribution of an intimate image -- Penalty.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1): 76-1-401; 76-1-101.5
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a): 76-1-401 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(i): "Distribute" means selling, exhibiting, displaying, wholesaling, retailing, providing, giving, granting admission to, providing access to, or otherwise transferring or presenting an image to another individual, with or without consideration.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(ii): "Intimate image" means any visual depiction, photograph, film, video, recording, picture, or computer or computer-generated image or picture, whether made or produced by electronic, mechanical, or other means, that depicts:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(ii)(A): exposed human male or female genitals or pubic area, with less than an opaque covering;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(ii)(B): a female breast with less than an opaque covering, or any portion of the female breast below the top of the areola; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(ii)(C): the individual engaged in any sexually explicit conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii): "Sexually explicit conduct" means actual or simulated:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(A): sexual intercourse, including genital-genital, oral-genital, anal-genital, or oral-anal, whether between persons of the same or opposite sex;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(B): masturbation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(C): bestiality;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(D): sadistic or masochistic activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(E): exhibition of the genitals, pubic region, buttocks, or female breast of any individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(F): visual depiction of nudity or partial nudity;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(G): fondling or touching of the genitals, pubic region, buttocks, or female breast; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iii)(H): explicit representation of the defecation or urination functions.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(iv): "Simulated sexually explicit conduct" means a feigned or pretended act of sexually explicit conduct that duplicates, within the perception of an average person, the appearance of an actual act of sexually explicit conduct.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(a)(v): 76-1-401 "Single criminal episode" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(1)(b): 76-1-101.5 Terms defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(2): (2)(b); (2)(a)(iv); (2)(a); (2)(b)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(2)(a): (2)(b) An actor commits the offense of distribution of an intimate image if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(2)(a)(i): the actor knowingly or intentionally distributes to a third party, or knowingly duplicates or copies an intimate image of an individual who is 18 years old or older and knows or should know that the distribution, duplication or copying would cause a reasonable person to suffer emotional distress or harm;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-5b-203(2)(a)(ii): the actor has not received consent from the individual depicted in the image to distribute the intimate image;
