-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-112(1): (3) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-112(2): An individual who violates this subsection is guilty of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-112(2)(a): a class C misdemeanor for the first offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-112(2)(b): a class B misdemeanor for any subsequent offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-112(3): A tobacco product may be distributed to an adult without charge at a professional convention where the general public is excluded.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-112(4): (1) The prohibition described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-113 Prohibition on distribution of flavored electronic cigarette products.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-113(1): It is unlawful for a tobacco retailer that is not a retail tobacco specialty business to give, distribute, sell, offer for sale, or furnish a flavored electronic cigarette product to any person.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-113(2): An individual who violates this section is guilty of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-113(2)(a): a class C misdemeanor for the first offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-113(2)(b): a class B misdemeanor for any subsequent offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114 Unlawful sale of a tobacco product, electronic cigarette product, or nicotine product.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(1)(a): "Compensatory service" means service or unpaid work performed by an employee, in lieu of the payment of a fine or imprisonment.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(1)(b): "Employee" means an employee or an owner of a tobacco retailer.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(2): It is unlawful for an employee to knowingly or intentionally sell or give a tobacco product, an electronic cigarette product, or a nicotine product in the course of business to an individual who is under 21 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3): An employee who violates this section is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(a): on a first violation:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(a)(i): guilty of an infraction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(a)(ii): subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(a)(ii)(A): a fine not exceeding $1,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(a)(ii)(B): compensatory service;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(b): on any subsequent violation:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(b)(i): guilty of a class C misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(b)(ii): subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(b)(ii)(A): a fine not exceeding $2,000; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-114(3)(b)(ii)(B): compensatory service.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115 Unlawful transfer or use of proof of age.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1): Title 53, Chapter 3, Part 8, Identification Card Act; Title 53, Chapter 3, Part 8, Identification Card Act; Title 53, Chapter 3, Uniform Driver License Act; 53-3-207 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a): Title 53, Chapter 3, Part 8, Identification Card Act; Title 53, Chapter 3, Part 8, Identification Card Act; Title 53, Chapter 3, Uniform Driver License Act "Proof of age" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(i): Title 53, Chapter 3, Part 8, Identification Card Act a valid identification card issued under
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(ii): Title 53, Chapter 3, Part 8, Identification Card Act a valid identification that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(ii)(A): Title 53, Chapter 3, Part 8, Identification Card Act is substantially similar to an identification card issued under
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(ii)(B): is issued in accordance with the laws of a state other than Utah in which the identification is issued;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(ii)(C): includes date of birth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(ii)(D): has a picture affixed;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(iii): Title 53, Chapter 3, Uniform Driver License Act a valid driver license certificate that is issued under
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(iv): a valid United States military identification card that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(iv)(A): includes date of birth; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(iv)(B): has a picture affixed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(a)(v): a valid passport.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(1)(b): 53-3-207 "Proof of age" does not include a driving privilege card issued in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(2): An individual is guilty of a class B misdemeanor if the individual knowingly and intentionally transfers that individual's proof of age to another individual to aid that individual in:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(2)(a): purchasing a tobacco product, an electronic cigarette product, or a nicotine product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(2)(b): gaining admittance to any part of the premises of a retail tobacco specialty business.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(3): An individual is guilty of a class A misdemeanor if the individual knowingly and intentionally uses proof of age containing false information with the intent to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(3)(a): purchase a tobacco product, an electronic cigarette product, or a nicotine product; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(3)(b): gain admittance to any part of the premises of a retail tobacco specialty business.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-115(4): (2); (3); 77-39-101(4) Subsections

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-201 Interference with water flow.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Every person who knowingly or intentionally interferes with or alters the flow of water in any stream, ditch, or lateral while under the control or management of any water commissioner is guilty of a crime punishable under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202 Taking water out of turn or excess amount -- Damaging facilities.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(1): No person may, in violation of any right of any other person knowingly or intentionally:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(1)(a): turn or use the water, or any part thereof, of any canal, ditch, pipeline, or reservoir, except at a time when the use of the water has been duly distributed to the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(1)(b): use any greater quantity of the water than has been duly distributed to him;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(1)(c): in any way change the flow of water when lawfully distributed for irrigation or other useful purposes, except when duly authorized to make the change; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(1)(d): break or injure any dam, canal, pipeline, watergate, ditch, or other means of diverting or conveying water for irrigation or other useful purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(2): (1); 73-3-3.5(1)(b) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(2)(a): a water right; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(2)(b): 73-3-3.5(1)(b) authorization of a person's use of water by:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(2)(b)(i): 73-3-3.5(1)(b) a water company, as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(2)(b)(ii): an entity having a valid water right under Utah law.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-202(3): 73-2-27 Any person who violates this section is guilty of a crime punishable under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-203 Obstruction of watergates.
----------------------------------------------------------
Every person who rafts or floats logs, timber, or wood down any river or stream and allows the logs, timber, or wood to accumulate at or obstruct the watergates owned by any person or irrigation company taking or diverting the water of the river or stream for irrigation or manufacturing purposes is guilty of a crime punishable under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-204 Damaging bridge, dam, canal, or other water-related structure.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-204(1): (2); 76-6-106(2)(a)(ii); 76-6-106.3 A person is guilty of a third degree felony who intentionally, knowingly, or recklessly commits an offense under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-204(2): (1) Offenses referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-204(2)(a): cuts, breaks, damages, or destroys any bridge, dam, canal, flume, aqueduct, levee, embankment, reservoir, or other structure erected to create hydraulic power, to drain or reclaim any swamp and overflowed or marsh land, to conduct water for mining, manufacturing, reclamation, or agricultural purposes, or for the supply of the inhabitants of any city or town;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-204(2)(b): makes or causes to be made any aperture in any dam, canal, flume, aqueduct, reservoir, embankment, levee, or structure with intent to injure or destroy it; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-204(2)(c): draws up, cuts, or injures any piles fixed in the ground and used for securing any lake or river bank or walls or any dock, quay, jetty, or lock.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-302 Marking of containers of explosives before transportation or storage.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every person who knowingly leaves with or delivers to another, or to any express or railway company or other common carrier, or to any warehouse or storehouse, any package containing nitroglycerin, dynamite, guncotton, gunpowder, or other highly explosive compound, or any benzine, gasoline, phosphorus, or other highly inflammable substance, or any vitriol, sulphuric, nitric, carbolic, muriatic, or other dangerous acid, chemical or compound, to be handled, stored, shipped, or transported, without plainly marking and indicating on such package the name and nature of the contents thereof, is guilty of a class B misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-303 Powder houses.
----------------------------------------------
Every person who builds, constructs, or uses within 300 feet of any residence or traveled county road any powder house, magazine, or building in which powder, dynamite, or other explosive is kept in quantities exceeding 500 pounds is guilty of a class B misdemeanor; provided that this section shall not apply to any magazine maintained at any mine or stone quarry.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-304 Marking of containers of explosives held for sale or use.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It shall be a class A misdemeanor to sell or offer for sale or take or solicit orders of sale, or purchase or use, or have on hand or in store for the purpose of sale or use, any giant, hercules, atlas, venture or any other high explosive containing nitroglycerin, unless on each box or package and wrapper containing any such high explosive there shall be plainly stamped or printed the name and place of business of the person, partnership, or corporation by whom or by which it was manufactured, and the exact and true date of its manufacture, and the percentage of nitroglycerin or other high explosive contained therein.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-305 Different dates on containers of explosives prohibited -- Reuse of containers prohibited.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It shall be unlawful for any person or persons, partnership, or corporation to have two or more different dates on any box or package containing giant, hercules, atlas, or venture, or any other high explosive containing nitroglycerin. It shall further be unlawful to use any box, package, or wrapper formerly used by any other person or persons, partnership, or corporation in the packing of such giant, hercules, atlas, venture, or other high explosive containing nitroglycerin, and the name and date on the box or package shall be the same as on the wrapper containing the giant, hercules, atlas, venture, or other explosive containing nitroglycerin.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306 Explosive, chemical, or incendiary device and parts -- Definitions -- Persons exempted -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1): As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(a): "Explosive, chemical, or incendiary device" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(a)(i): dynamite and all other forms of high explosives, including water gel, slurry, military C-4 (plastic explosives), blasting agents to include nitro-carbon-nitrate, ammonium nitrate, fuel oil mixtures, cast primers and boosters, R.D.X., P.E.T.N., electric and nonelectric blasting caps, exploding cords commonly called detonating cord, detcord, or primacord, picric acid explosives, T.N.T. and T.N.T. mixtures, nitroglycerin and nitroglycerin mixtures, or any other chemical mixture intended to explode with fire or force;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(a)(ii): any explosive bomb, grenade, missile, or similar device; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(a)(iii): any incendiary bomb, grenade, fire bomb, chemical bomb, or similar device, including any device, except kerosene lamps, if criminal intent has not been established, which consists of or includes a breakable container including a flammable liquid or compound and a wick composed of any material which, when ignited, is capable of igniting the flammable liquid or compound or any breakable container which consists of, or includes a chemical mixture that explodes with fire or force and can be carried, thrown, or placed.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(b): "Explosive, chemical, or incendiary device" does not include rifle, pistol, or shotgun ammunition, reloading components, or muzzleloading equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(c): "Explosive, chemical, or incendiary parts" means any substances or materials or combinations which have been prepared or altered for use in the creation of an explosive, chemical, or incendiary device.  These substances or materials include:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(c)(i): timing device, clock, or watch which has been altered in such a manner as to be used as the arming device in an explosive;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(c)(ii): pipe, end caps, or metal tubing which has been prepared for a pipe bomb; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(c)(iii): mechanical timers, mechanical triggers, chemical time delays, electronic time delays, or commercially made or improvised items which, when used singly or in combination, may be used in the construction of a timing delay mechanism, booby trap, or activating mechanism for any explosive, chemical, or incendiary device.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(1)(d): "Explosive, chemical, or incendiary parts" does not include rifle, pistol, or shotgun ammunition, or any signaling device customarily used in operation of railroad equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(2): (3); (6); 11-3-3.5; 53-7-223 The provisions in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(2)(a): any public safety officer while acting in an official capacity transporting or otherwise handling explosives, chemical, or incendiary devices;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(2)(b): any member of the armed forces of the United States or Utah National Guard while acting in an official capacity;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(2)(c): any person possessing a valid permit issued under the provisions of Uniform Fire Code, Article 77, or any employee of the permittee acting within the scope of employment;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(2)(d): 11-3-3.5; 53-7-223 any person possessing a valid license as an importer, wholesaler, display operator, special effects operator, or flame effects operator under the provisions of Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(2)(e): any person or entity possessing or controlling an explosive, chemical, or incendiary device as part of its lawful business operations.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(3): Part 4, Weapons of Mass Destruction Any person is guilty of a second degree felony who, under circumstances not amounting to a violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(4): Part 4, Weapons of Mass Destruction; 76-8-311.1; 76-8-311.3; 76-10-529; 78A-2-203 Any person is guilty of a first degree felony who, under circumstances not amounting to a violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(4)(a): uses or causes to be used an explosive, chemical, or incendiary device in the commission of or an attempt to commit a felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(4)(b): injures another or attempts to injure another person or another person's property through the use of an explosive, chemical, or incendiary device; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(4)(c): 76-8-311.1; 76-8-311.3; 76-10-529; 78A-2-203 transports, possesses, distributes, or sells any explosive, chemical, or incendiary device in a secure area established pursuant to Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(5): Part 4, Weapons of Mass Destruction Any person who, under circumstances not amounting to a violation of
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-306(6): Part 4, Weapons of Mass Destruction Any person who, under circumstances not amounting to a violation of


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-307 Explosive, chemical, or incendiary device -- Delivery to common carrier or mailing.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person is guilty of a felony of the second degree who delivers or causes to be delivered to any express or railway company or other common carrier, or to any person, any explosive, chemical, or incendiary device, knowing it to be the device, without informing the common carrier or person of its nature or sends it through the mail.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-308 Explosive, chemical, or incendiary device -- Venue of prosecution for shipping.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who knowingly, intentionally, or recklessly delivers any explosive, chemical, or incendiary device to any person for transmission without the consent or direction of the lawful possessor may be prosecuted in the county in which he delivers it or in the county to which it is transmitted.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(1): "Biological agent" means any microorganism, virus, infectious substance, or biological product that may be engineered as a result of biotechnology, or any naturally occurring or bioengineered component of any microorganism, virus, infectious substance, or biological product, that is capable of causing:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(1)(a): death, disease, or other biological malfunction in a human, an animal, a plant, or another living organism;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(1)(b): deterioration of food, water, equipment, supplies, or material of any kind; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(1)(c): deleterious alteration of the environment.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(2): "Delivery system" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(2)(a): any apparatus, equipment, device, or means of delivery specifically designed to deliver or disseminate a biological agent, toxin, or vector; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(2)(b): any vector.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(3): "Hoax weapon of mass destruction" means any device or object that by its design, construction, content, or characteristics appears to be or to contain, or is represented to be, constitute, or contain, a weapon of mass destruction as defined in this section, but which is, in fact, an inoperative facsimile, imitation, counterfeit, or representation of a weapon of mass destruction which does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(3)(a): meet the definition of a weapon of mass destruction; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(3)(b): actually contain or constitute a weapon, biological agent, toxin, vector, or delivery system prohibited by this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(4): (4)(a) "Toxin" means the toxic material of plants, animals, microorganisms, viruses, fungi, or infectious substances, or a recombinant molecule, whatever its origin or method of production, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(4)(a): any poisonous substance or biological product that may be engineered as a result of biotechnology produced by a living organism; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(4)(b): (4)(a) any poisonous isomer or biological product, homolog, or derivative of the substance under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(5): "Vector" means a living organism, or molecule, including a recombinant molecule, or biological product that may be engineered as a result of biotechnology, capable of carrying a biological agent or toxin to a host.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6): (6)(a)(i); (iv)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6)(a): (6)(a)(i); (iv) "Weapon of mass destruction" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6)(a)(i): any item or instrumentality that is designed or intended to cause widespread death or serious bodily injury to multiple victims;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6)(a)(ii): any item or instrumentality that is designed or intended to cause death or serious bodily injury through the release, dissemination, or impact of toxic or poisonous chemicals, or their precursors;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6)(a)(iii): any disease organism, including any biological agent, toxin, or vector which is used or intended to be used as a weapon;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6)(a)(iv): any item or instrumentality that is designed to release radiation or radioactivity at a level dangerous to human life and that is used or intended to be used as a weapon; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6)(a)(v): (6)(a)(i); (iv) any substance or material or combination which has been prepared or altered for use in the creation of a weapon described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-401(6)(b): "Weapon of mass destruction" does not include firearms or rifle, pistol, or shotgun ammunition, reloading components, or muzzleloading equipment.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-402 Manufacture, possession, sale, use, or attempted use of a weapon of mass destruction prohibited -- Penalties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person who without lawful authority intentionally or knowingly manufactures, possesses, sells, delivers, displays, uses, attempts to use, solicits the use of, or conspires to use a weapon of mass destruction or a delivery system for a weapon of mass destruction, including any biological agent, toxin, vector, or delivery system as those terms are defined in this section, is guilty of a first degree felony.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-403 Manufacture, possession, sale, use, or attempted use of a hoax weapon of mass destruction prohibited -- Penalty.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who without lawful authority intentionally or knowingly manufactures, possesses, sells, delivers, displays, uses, attempts to use, solicits the use of, or conspires to use a hoax weapon of mass destruction with the intent to deceive or otherwise mislead another person into believing that the hoax weapon of mass destruction is a weapon of mass destruction is guilty of a second degree felony.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-404 Exemptions.
-------------------------------------------
This part does not apply to any member or employee of the Armed Forces of the United States, allied armed forces personnel, a federal or state governmental agency, or a private entity, who is engaged in lawful activity within the scope of his or her employment, if the person is authorized or licensed to manufacture, possess, sell, deliver, display, or otherwise engage in activity relative to this section and if the person is in compliance with applicable federal and state law.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-405 Reimbursement of government response expenses.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In addition to any other penalty authorized by law, a court shall order any person convicted of any violation of this part to reimburse any federal, state, or local unit of government, or any private business, organization, individual, or entity for all expenses and losses incurred in responding to the violation, unless the court states on the record the reasons why the reimbursement would be inappropriate.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500 Uniform law.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(1): 78B-6-2301; 53-5a-102; 78B-6-2301 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(1)(a): 78B-6-2301 "Directive" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(1)(b): 53-5a-102 "Firearm" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(1)(c): 78B-6-2301 "Local or state governmental entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(2): The individual right to keep and bear arms being a constitutionally protected right under Article I, Section 6, of the Utah Constitution and the Second Amendment to the United States Constitution, the Legislature finds the need to provide uniform civil and criminal laws throughout the state and declares that the Legislature occupies the whole field of state regulation of firearms.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(3): Except as specifically provided by state law, a local or state governmental entity may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(3)(a): prohibit an individual from owning, possessing, purchasing, selling, transferring, transporting, or keeping any firearm at the individual's place of residence, property, business, or in any vehicle lawfully in the individual's possession or lawfully under the individual's control; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(3)(b): require an individual to have a permit or license to purchase, own, possess, transport, or keep a firearm.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(4): This part is uniformly applicable throughout this state and in all the state's political subdivisions.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(5): Authority to regulate firearms is reserved to the state except where the Legislature specifically delegates responsibility to local or state governmental entities.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(6): Unless specifically authorized by the Legislature by statute, a local or state governmental entity may not enact or enforce a directive pertaining to firearms that in any way inhibits or restricts the possession, ownership, purchase, sale, transfer, transport, or use of firearms on either public or private property.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(7): This part does not restrict or expand private property rights.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-500(8): Title 78B, Chapter 6, Part 23, Firearm Preemption Enforcement Act A violation of this section is subject to


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1): (1)(a); (1)(b)(iii)(A); (B); (C)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a): (1)(a) "Antique firearm" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(i): any firearm, including any firearm with a matchlock, flintlock, percussion cap, or similar type of ignition system, manufactured in or before 1898;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(ii): (1)(a) a firearm that is a replica of any firearm described in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(ii)(A): is not designed or redesigned for using rimfire or conventional centerfire fixed ammunition; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(ii)(B): uses rimfire or centerfire fixed ammunition which is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(ii)(B)(I): no longer manufactured in the United States; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(ii)(B)(II): is not readily available in ordinary channels of commercial trade; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(iii)(A): that is a muzzle loading rifle, shotgun, or pistol; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(a)(iii)(B): is designed to use black powder, or a black powder substitute, and cannot use fixed ammunition.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b): (1)(b)(iii)(A); (B); (C) "Antique firearm" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b)(i): a weapon that incorporates a firearm frame or receiver;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b)(ii): a firearm that is converted into a muzzle loading weapon; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b)(iii): (1)(b)(iii)(A); (B); (C) a muzzle loading weapon that can be readily converted to fire fixed ammunition by replacing the:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b)(iii)(A): barrel;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b)(iii)(B): bolt;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b)(iii)(C): breechblock; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(1)(b)(iii)(D): (1)(b)(iii)(A); (B); (C) any combination of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(2): 53-10-201 "Bureau" means the Bureau of Criminal Identification created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(3)(a): "Concealed firearm" means a firearm that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(3)(a)(i): covered, hidden, or secreted in a manner that the public would not be aware of its presence; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(3)(a)(ii): readily accessible for immediate use.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(3)(b): A firearm that is unloaded and securely encased is not a concealed firearm for the purposes of this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(4): "Criminal history background check" means a criminal background check conducted by a licensed firearms dealer on every purchaser of a handgun, except a Federal Firearms Licensee, through the bureau or the local law enforcement agency where the firearms dealer conducts business.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5): (5)(b)(i) "Curio or relic firearm" means a firearm that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(a): is of special interest to a collector because of a quality that is not associated with firearms intended for:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(a)(i): sporting use;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(a)(ii): use as an offensive weapon; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(a)(iii): use as a defensive weapon;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(b): (5)(b)(i)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(b)(i): was manufactured at least 50 years before the current date; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(b)(ii): (5)(b)(i) is not a replica of a firearm described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(c): is certified by the curator of a municipal, state, or federal museum that exhibits firearms to be a curio or relic of museum interest;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d): derives a substantial part of its monetary value:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(i): from the fact that the firearm is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(i)(A): novel;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(i)(B): rare; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(i)(C): bizarre; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(ii): because of the firearm's association with an historical:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(ii)(A): figure;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(ii)(B): period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(d)(ii)(C): event; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(5)(e): has been designated as a curio or relic firearm by the director of the United States Treasury Department Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms under 27 C.F.R. Sec. 478.11.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6): 76-10-306
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(a): "Dangerous weapon" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(a)(i): a firearm; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(a)(ii): an object that in the manner of its use or intended use is capable of causing death or serious bodily injury.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(b): The following factors are used in determining whether any object, other than a firearm, is a dangerous weapon:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(b)(i): the location and circumstances in which the object was used or possessed;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(b)(ii): the primary purpose for which the object was made;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(b)(iii): the character of the wound, if any, produced by the object's unlawful use;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(b)(iv): the manner in which the object was unlawfully used;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(b)(v): whether the manner in which the object is used or possessed constitutes a potential imminent threat to public safety; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(b)(vi): the lawful purposes for which the object may be used.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(6)(c): 76-10-306 "Dangerous weapon" does not include an explosive, chemical, or incendiary device as defined by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(7)(a): "Dating relationship" means a romantic or intimate relationship between individuals.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(7)(b): "Dating relationship" does not include a casual acquaintanceship or ordinary fraternization in a business or social context.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(8): "Dealer" means a person who is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(8)(a): licensed under 18 U.S.C. Sec. 923; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(8)(b): engaged in the business of selling, leasing, or otherwise transferring a handgun, whether the person is a retail or wholesale dealer, pawnbroker, or otherwise.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(9): 77-36-1 "Domestic violence" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(10): "Enter" means intrusion of the entire body.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(11): "Federal Firearms Licensee" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(11)(a): holds a valid Federal Firearms License issued under 18 U.S.C. Sec. 923; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(11)(b): is engaged in the activities authorized by the specific category of license held.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(12): 76-10-526; 76-10-527
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(12)(a): "Firearm" means a pistol, revolver, shotgun, short barreled shotgun, rifle or short barreled rifle, or a device that could be used as a dangerous weapon from which is expelled a projectile by action of an explosive.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(12)(b): 76-10-526; 76-10-527 As used in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(13): "Firearms transaction record form" means a form created by the bureau to be completed by a person purchasing, selling, or transferring a handgun from a dealer in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(14): "Fully automatic weapon" means a firearm which fires, is designed to fire, or can be readily restored to fire, automatically more than one shot without manual reloading by a single function of the trigger.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(15): 76-10-520; 76-10-521; 76-10-522
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(15)(a): "Handgun" means a pistol, revolver, or other firearm of any description, loaded or unloaded, from which a shot, bullet, or other missile can be discharged, the length of which, not including any revolving, detachable, or magazine breech, does not exceed 12 inches.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(15)(b): 76-10-520; 76-10-521; 76-10-522 As used in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(16): "House of worship" means a church, temple, synagogue, mosque, or other building set apart primarily for the purpose of worship in which religious services are held and the main body of which is kept for that use and not put to any other use inconsistent with its primary purpose.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(17): "Machinegun firearm attachment" means any part or combination of parts added to a semiautomatic firearm that allows the firearm to fire as a fully automatic weapon.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(18): "Prohibited area" means a place where it is unlawful to discharge a firearm.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(19): "Readily accessible for immediate use" means that a firearm or other dangerous weapon is carried on the person or within such close proximity and in such a manner that it can be retrieved and used as readily as if carried on the person.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(20): "Residence" means an improvement to real property used or occupied as a primary or secondary residence.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(21): "Securely encased" means not readily accessible for immediate use, such as held in a gun rack, or in a closed case or container, whether or not locked, or in a trunk or other storage area of a motor vehicle, not including a glove box or console box.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(22): "Short barreled shotgun" or "short barreled rifle" means a shotgun having a barrel or barrels of fewer than 18 inches in length, or in the case of a rifle, having a barrel or barrels of fewer than 16 inches in length, or a dangerous weapon made from a rifle or shotgun by alteration, modification, or otherwise, if the weapon as modified has an overall length of fewer than 26 inches.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(23): "Shotgun" means a smooth bore firearm designed to fire cartridges containing pellets or a single slug.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(24): "Shoulder arm" means a firearm that is designed to be fired while braced against the shoulder.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(25): 76-1-401 "Single criminal episode" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(26): "Slug" means a single projectile discharged from a shotgun shell.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(27): "State entity" means a department, commission, board, council, agency, institution, officer, corporation, fund, division, office, committee, authority, laboratory, library, unit, bureau, panel, or other administrative unit of the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-501(28): 76-3-203.5 "Violent felony" means the same as that term is defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-502 When weapon deemed loaded.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-502(1): For the purpose of this chapter, any pistol, revolver, shotgun, rifle, or other weapon described in this part shall be deemed to be loaded when there is an unexpended cartridge, shell, or projectile in the firing position.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-502(2): Pistols and revolvers shall also be deemed to be loaded when an unexpended cartridge, shell, or projectile is in a position whereby the manual operation of any mechanism once would cause the unexpended cartridge, shell, or projectile to be fired.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-502(3): A muzzle loading firearm shall be deemed to be loaded when it is capped or primed and has a powder charge and ball or shot in the barrel or cylinders.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503 Restrictions on possession, purchase, transfer, and ownership of dangerous weapons by certain persons -- Exceptions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1): 80-1-102; 80-6-701; 76-3-203.5; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2; (1)(b)(ii)(A); 58-37-2; 58-37-2; (1)(d); 76-5-102; 76-5-103; 80-6-701; 80-6-701; (1)(b)(xii); 80-6-701; (1)(c); (1)(b)(xii)(D); (1)(b)(xii)(D); (1)(a); (b) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a): 80-1-102; 80-6-701; 76-3-203.5; 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 A Category I restricted person is a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(i): has been convicted of a violent felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(ii): is on probation or parole for a felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(iii): 80-1-102 is on parole from secure care, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(iv): 80-6-701; 76-3-203.5 within the last 10 years has been adjudicated under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(v): is an alien who is illegally or unlawfully in the United States; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(vi): 58-37-4; 58-37-4.2 is on probation for a conviction of possessing:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(vi)(A): 58-37-4 a substance classified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(vi)(B): a controlled substance analog; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(a)(vi)(C): 58-37-4.2 a substance listed in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b): (1)(b)(ii)(A); 58-37-2; 58-37-2; (1)(d); 76-5-102; 76-5-103 A Category II restricted person is a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(i): has been convicted of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(i)(A): a domestic violence offense that is a felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(i)(B): a felony that is not a domestic violence offense or a violent felony and within seven years after completing the sentence for the conviction, has been convicted of or charged with another felony or class A misdemeanor;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(i)(C): multiple felonies that are part of a single criminal episode and are not domestic violence offenses or violent felonies and within seven years after completing the sentence for the convictions, has been convicted of or charged with another felony or class A misdemeanor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(i)(D): multiple felonies that are not part of a single criminal episode;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(ii): (1)(b)(ii)(A)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(ii)(A): within the last seven years has completed a sentence for:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(ii)(A)(I): a conviction for a felony that is not a domestic violence offense or a violent felony; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(ii)(A)(II): convictions for multiple felonies that are part of a single criminal episode and are not domestic violence offenses or violent felonies; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(ii)(B): (1)(b)(ii)(A) within the last seven years and after the completion of a sentence for a conviction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(iii): within the last seven years has been adjudicated delinquent for an offense which if committed by an adult would have been a felony;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(iv): 58-37-2 is an unlawful user of a controlled substance as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(v): 58-37-2 is in possession of a dangerous weapon and is knowingly and intentionally in unlawful possession of a Schedule I or II controlled substance as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(vi): has been found not guilty by reason of insanity for a felony offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(vii): has been found mentally incompetent to stand trial for a felony offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(viii): has been adjudicated as mentally defective as provided in the Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act, Pub. L. No. 103-159, 107 Stat. 1536 (1993), or has been committed to a mental institution;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(ix): has been dishonorably discharged from the armed forces;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(x): has renounced the individual's citizenship after having been a citizen of the United States;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xi): is a respondent or defendant subject to a protective order or child protective order that is issued after a hearing for which the respondent or defendant received actual notice and at which the respondent or defendant has an opportunity to participate, that restrains the respondent or defendant from harassing, stalking, threatening, or engaging in other conduct that would place an intimate partner, as defined in 18 U.S.C. Sec. 921, or a child of the intimate partner, in reasonable fear of bodily injury to the intimate partner or child of the intimate partner, and that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xi)(A): includes a finding that the respondent or defendant represents a credible threat to the physical safety of an individual who meets the definition of an intimate partner in 18 U.S.C. Sec. 921 or the child of the individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xi)(B): explicitly prohibits the use, attempted use, or threatened use of physical force that would reasonably be expected to cause bodily harm against an intimate partner or the child of an intimate partner; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xii): (1)(d); 76-5-102; 76-5-103 except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xii)(A): who is a current or former spouse, parent, or guardian;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xii)(B): with whom the restricted person shares a child in common;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xii)(C): who is cohabitating or has cohabitated with the restricted person as a spouse, parent, or guardian;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xii)(D): involved in a dating relationship with the restricted person within the last five years; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(1)(b)(xii)(E): similarly situated to a spouse, parent, or guardian of the restricted person.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(2): A Category I restricted person who intentionally or knowingly agrees, consents, offers, or arranges to purchase, transfer, possess, use, or have under the person's custody or control, or who intentionally or knowingly purchases, transfers, possesses, uses, or has under the person's custody or control:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(2)(a): a firearm is guilty of a second degree felony; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(2)(b): a dangerous weapon other than a firearm is guilty of a third degree felony.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(3): A Category II restricted person who intentionally or knowingly purchases, transfers, possesses, uses, or has under the person's custody or control:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(3)(a): a firearm is guilty of a third degree felony; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(3)(b): a dangerous weapon other than a firearm is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(4): A person may be subject to the restrictions of both categories at the same time.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(6): If a higher penalty than is prescribed in this section is provided in another section for one who purchases, transfers, possesses, uses, or has under this custody or control a dangerous weapon, the penalties of that section control.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(7)(a): in possession of a controlled substance pursuant to a lawful order of a practitioner for use of a member of the person's household or for administration to an animal owned by the person or a member of the person's household; or

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(8)(a)(iii): is not being held as evidence by a court or law enforcement agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(8)(a)(iv): was transferred to a person not legally prohibited from possessing the weapon; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(8)(a)(v): unless a different time is ordered by the court, was transferred within 10 days of the person becoming a restricted person.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(10): (10)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(10)(a): A person may not knowingly solicit, persuade, encourage or entice a dealer or other person to sell, transfer or otherwise dispose of a firearm or dangerous weapon under circumstances which the person knows would be a violation of the law.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(10)(b): A person may not provide to a dealer or other person information that the person knows to be materially false information with intent to deceive the dealer or other person about the legality of a sale, transfer or other disposition of a firearm or dangerous weapon.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(10)(c): "Materially false information" means information that portrays an illegal transaction as legal or a legal transaction as illegal.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(10)(d): (10) A person who violates this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(10)(d)(i): a third degree felony if the transaction involved a firearm; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503(10)(d)(ii): a class A misdemeanor if the transaction involved a dangerous weapon other than a firearm.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1 Firearm restriction notification requirement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(1): 53-13-102; 76-10-503 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(1)(a): 53-13-102 "Peace officer" means an officer described Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(1)(b): "Possess" means actual physical possession, actual or purported ownership, or exercising control of an item.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(1)(c): 76-10-503 "Restricted person" means an individual who is restricted from possessing, purchasing, transferring, or owning a firearm under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2): A defendant intending to plead guilty or no contest to a criminal charge that will, upon conviction, cause the defendant to become a restricted person shall, before entering a plea before a court, sign an acknowledgment that states:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(a): the defendant's attorney or the prosecuting attorney has informed the defendant:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(a)(i): that conviction of the charge will classify the defendant as a restricted person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(a)(ii): that a restricted person may not possess a firearm; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(a)(iii): of the criminal penalties associated with possession of a firearm by a restricted person of the same category the defendant will become upon entering a plea for the criminal charge; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(b): the defendant acknowledges and understands that, by pleading guilty or no contest to the criminal charge, the defendant:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(b)(i): will be a restricted person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(b)(ii): upon conviction, shall forfeit possession of each firearm currently possessed by the defendant; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(2)(b)(iii): will be in violation of federal and state law if the defendant possesses a firearm.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(3): (2) The prosecuting attorney or the defendant's attorney shall provide the acknowledgment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4): A defendant who is convicted by trial of a criminal charge resulting in the defendant becoming a restricted person shall, at the time of sentencing:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(a): be verbally informed by the court, prosecuting attorney, or defendant's attorney:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(a)(i): that the defendant is a restricted person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(a)(ii): that, as a restricted person, the defendant may not possess a firearm; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(a)(iii): of the criminal penalties associated with possession of a firearm by a restricted person of the defendant's category; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(b): sign an acknowledgment in the presence of the court attesting that the defendant acknowledges and understands that the defendant:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(b)(i): is a restricted person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(b)(ii): shall forfeit possession of each firearm; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(4)(b)(iii): will be in violation of federal and state law if the defendant possesses a firearm.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(5): The prosecuting attorney and the defendant's attorney shall inform the court at the preliminary hearing if a charge filed against the defendant would qualify the defendant as a restricted person if the defendant is convicted of the charge.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(6): The failure to inform or obtain a signed acknowledgment from the defendant may not render the plea invalid, form the basis for withdrawal of the plea, or create a basis to challenge a conviction or sentence.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7): 78B-7-803; 77-36-5; 77-36-5; 76-10-503 An individual who becomes a restricted person as a result of being served with a pretrial protective order in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(a): be verbally informed by the court, prosecuting attorney, defendant's attorney, or, if a peace officer is serving the protective order, the peace officer:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(a)(i): that the individual is a restricted person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(a)(ii): that, as a restricted person, the individual may not possess a firearm; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(a)(iii): of the criminal penalties associated with possession of a firearm by a restricted person of the individual's category; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(b): 76-10-503 sign, in the presence of the court or, if a peace officer serves the protective order, in the presence of the peace officer, an acknowledgment contained within the protective order document attesting that the individual acknowledges and understands that the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(b)(i): is a restricted person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(b)(ii): is required to relinquish possession of each firearm;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(b)(iii): will be in violation of federal and state law if the individual possesses a firearm; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-503.1(7)(b)(iv): 76-10-503 may be eligible for an affirmative defense to a state-law prosecution for possession of a firearm under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504 Carrying concealed firearm -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504(1): 76-10-503; 76-10-523; (2); (3); (4); 76-10-501 Except as provided in Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504(2): (1) A person who carries a concealed firearm that is a loaded firearm in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504(3): A person who carries concealed an unlawfully possessed short barreled shotgun or a short barreled rifle is guilty of a second degree felony.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504(4): 76-3-203.5 If the concealed firearm is used in the commission of a violent felony as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504(5): (1); (2); Title 23A, Wildlife Resources Act; 41-6a-102 Nothing in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504(5)(a): within the limits of a municipality in violation of that municipality's ordinances; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-504(5)(b): 41-6a-102 upon the highways of the state as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505 Carrying loaded firearm in vehicle or on street.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(1): Unless otherwise authorized by law, a person may not carry a loaded firearm:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(1)(a): in or on a vehicle, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(1)(a)(i): the vehicle is in the person's lawful possession; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(1)(a)(ii): the person is carrying the loaded firearm in a vehicle with the consent of the person lawfully in possession of the vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(1)(b): on a public street; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(1)(c): in a posted prohibited area.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(2): (1)(a) Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(3): (1)(a)(i); (ii); 76-10-523(5) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505(4): A violation of this section is a class B misdemeanor.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5 Possession of a dangerous weapon, firearm, or short barreled shotgun on or about school premises -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1): As used in this section, "on or about school premises" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(a)(i): in a public or private elementary or secondary school; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(a)(ii): on the grounds of any of those schools;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(b)(i): in a public or private institution of higher education; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(b)(ii): on the grounds of a public or private institution of higher education; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(b)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(b)(iii)(A): inside the building where a preschool or child care is being held, if the entire building is being used for the operation of the preschool or child care; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(1)(b)(iii)(B): if only a portion of a building is being used to operate a preschool or child care, in that room or rooms where the preschool or child care operation is being held.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(2): 76-10-501 A person may not possess any dangerous weapon, firearm, or short barreled shotgun, as those terms are defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(3)(a): Possession of a dangerous weapon on or about school premises is a class B misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(3)(b): Possession of a firearm or short barreled shotgun on or about school premises is a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4): 53-5-704; 53-5-705; 76-10-511; 76-10-523; 53-5-704.5; 53-5-710(2) This section does not apply if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4)(a): 53-5-704; 53-5-705; 76-10-511; 76-10-523 the person is authorized to possess a firearm as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4)(b): 53-5-704.5; 53-5-710(2) the person is authorized to possess a firearm as provided under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4)(c): the possession is approved by the responsible school administrator;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4)(d): the item is present or to be used in connection with a lawful, approved activity and is in the possession or under the control of the person responsible for its possession or use; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4)(e): the possession is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4)(e)(i): at the person's place of residence or on the person's property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(4)(e)(ii): in any vehicle lawfully under the person's control, other than a vehicle owned by the school or used by the school to transport students.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-505.5(5): This section does not prohibit prosecution of a more serious weapons offense that may occur on or about school premises.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506 Threatening with or using dangerous weapon in fight or quarrel.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1): 76-2-402(3)(a) As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1)(a): "Dangerous weapon" means an item that in the manner of its use or intended use is capable of causing death or serious bodily injury. The following factors shall be used in determining whether an item, object, or thing is a dangerous weapon:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1)(a)(i): the character of the instrument, object, or thing;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1)(a)(ii): the character of the wound produced, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1)(a)(iii): the manner in which the instrument, object, or thing was exhibited or used.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1)(b): 76-2-402(3)(a) "Threatening manner" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1)(b)(i): the possession of a dangerous weapon, whether visible or concealed, without additional behavior which is threatening; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(1)(b)(ii): 76-2-402(3)(a) informing another of the actor's possession of a deadly weapon to prevent what the actor reasonably perceives as a possible use of unlawful force by the other and the actor is not engaged in any activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(2): 76-2-402; 76-10-503; 76-5-103 Except as otherwise provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(3): 76-2-402 This section does not apply to an individual who, reasonably believing the action to be necessary in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(3)(a): threatens the use of a dangerous weapon; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(3)(b): draws or exhibits a dangerous weapon.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-506(4): 76-10-523(1)(a); (f) This section does not apply to an individual listed in Subsections


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-507 Possession of deadly weapon with criminal intent.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every person having upon his person any dangerous weapon with intent to use it to commit a criminal offense is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508 Discharge of firearm from a vehicle, near a highway, or in direction of specified items -- Penalties.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a): An individual may not discharge a dangerous weapon or firearm:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(i): from an automobile or other vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(ii): from, upon, or across a highway;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(iii): at a road sign placed upon a highway of the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(iv): at communications equipment or property of public utilities including facilities, lines, poles, or devices of transmission or distribution;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(v): at railroad equipment or facilities including a sign or signal;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(vi): within a Utah State Park building, designated camp or picnic sites, overlooks, golf courses, boat ramps, and developed beaches; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(vii): without written permission to discharge the dangerous weapon from the owner or person in charge of the property within 600 feet of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(vii)(A): a house, dwelling, or any other building; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(a)(vii)(B): any structure in which a domestic animal is kept or fed, including a barn, poultry yard, corral, feeding pen, or stockyard.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(1)(b): It is a defense to any charge for violating this section that the individual being accused had actual permission of the owner or person in charge of the property at the time in question.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(2): (1) A violation of any provision of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(3): 53-3-220(1)(a)(xi); 53-3-225(1)(c) In addition to any other penalties, the court shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(3)(a): 53-3-220(1)(a)(xi) notify the Driver License Division of the conviction for purposes of any revocation, denial, suspension, or disqualification of a driver license under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(3)(b): 53-3-225(1)(c) specify in court at the time of sentencing the length of the revocation under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4): 23A-5-202; 76-10-523(1)(a); (f); (4)(c)(i); (1) This section does not apply to an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(a): discharges a firearm when that individual is in lawful defense of self or others;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(b): 23A-5-202; 76-10-523(1)(a); (f) is performing official duties as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(c): (4)(c)(i); (1) discharges a dangerous weapon or firearm from an automobile or other vehicle, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(c)(i): the discharge occurs at a firing range or training ground;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(c)(ii): (4)(c)(i) at no time after the discharge does the projectile that is discharged cross over or stop at a location other than within the boundaries of the firing range or training ground described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(c)(iii): the discharge is made as practice or training for a lawful purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(c)(iv): the discharge and the location, time, and manner of the discharge are approved by the owner or operator of the firing range or training ground before the discharge; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-508(4)(c)(v): (1) the discharge is not made in violation of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509 Possession of dangerous weapon by minor.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509(1): A minor under 18 years of age may not possess a dangerous weapon unless he:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509(1)(a): has the permission of his parent or guardian to have  the weapon; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509(1)(b): is accompanied by a parent or guardian while he has  the weapon in his possession.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509(2): Any minor under 14 years of age in possession of a dangerous weapon shall be accompanied by a responsible adult.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509(3): Any person who violates this section is guilty of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509(3)(a): a class B misdemeanor upon the first offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509(3)(b): a class A misdemeanor for each subsequent offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4 Prohibition of possession of certain weapons by minors.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(1): An individual who is under 18 years old may not possess a handgun.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(2): Except as provided by federal law, an individual who is under 18 years old may not possess the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(2)(a): a short barreled rifle;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(2)(b): a short barreled shotgun;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(2)(c): a fully automatic weapon; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(2)(d): a machinegun firearm attachment.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(3): (1) An individual who violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(3)(a): a class B misdemeanor upon the first offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(3)(b): a class A misdemeanor for each subsequent offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.4(4): (2) An individual who violates Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.5 Penalties for providing certain weapons to a minor.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.5(1): 76-10-509.4 Any person who provides a handgun to a minor when the possession of the handgun by the minor is a violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.5(1)(a): a class B misdemeanor upon the first offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.5(1)(b): a class A misdemeanor for each subsequent offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.5(2): Any person who transfers in violation of applicable state or federal law a short barreled rifle, short barreled shotgun, or fully automatic weapon to a minor is guilty of a third degree felony.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.6 Parent or guardian providing firearm to violent minor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.6(1): 76-3-203.5 A parent or guardian may not intentionally or knowingly provide a firearm to, or permit the possession of a firearm by, any minor who has been convicted of a violent felony as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.6(2): Any person who violates this section is guilty of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.6(2)(a): a class A misdemeanor upon the first offense; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.6(2)(b): a third degree felony for each subsequent offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.7 Parent or guardian knowing of minor's possession of dangerous weapon.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any parent or guardian of a minor who knows that the minor is in possession of a dangerous weapon in violation of Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.9 Sales of firearms to juveniles.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.9(1): A person may not sell any firearm to a minor under 18 years of age unless the minor is accompanied by a parent or guardian.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-509.9(2): Any person who violates this section is guilty of a third degree felony.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-511 Possession of loaded firearm at residence or on real property authorized.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Except for persons described in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 76-10-511(1): at the person's place of residence, including any temporary residence or camp; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-511(2): on the person's real property.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512 Target concessions, shooting ranges, competitions, and hunting excepted from prohibitions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1): 76-10-509; 76-10-509.4(1); (1)(b); (c); (d); (e); (f) The provisions of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1)(a): patrons firing at lawfully operated target concessions at amusement parks, piers, and similar locations provided that the firearms to be used are firmly chained or affixed to the counters;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1)(b): any person in attendance at a hunter's safety course or a firearms safety course;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1)(c): any person engaging in practice or any other lawful use of a firearm at an established range or any other area where the discharge of a firearm is not prohibited by state or local law;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1)(d): any person engaging in an organized competition involving the use of a firearm, or participating in or practicing for such competition;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1)(e): any minor under 18 years of age who is on real property with the permission of the owner, licensee, or lessee of the property and who has the permission of a parent or legal guardian or the owner, licensee, or lessee to possess a firearm not otherwise in violation of law;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1)(f): any resident or nonresident hunters with a valid hunting license or other persons who are lawfully engaged in hunting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(1)(g): (1)(b); (c); (d); (e); (f) any person traveling to or from any activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(2): 76-10-503(2); (3); 76-10-503(1) It is not a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(3): (2); 76-10-503(1) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(3)(a): a court, as a condition of pre-trial release or probation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-512(3)(b): the Board of Pardons and Parole, as a condition of parole.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-520 Number or mark assigned to pistol or revolver by Department of Public Safety.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Department of Public Safety upon request may assign a distinguishing number or mark of identification to any pistol or revolver whenever it is without a manufacturer's number, or other mark of identification or whenever the manufacturer's number or other mark of identification or the distinguishing number or mark assigned by the Department of Public Safety has been destroyed or obliterated.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-521 Unlawful marking of pistol or revolver.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-521(1): Any person who places or stamps on any pistol or revolver any number except one assigned to it by the Department of Public Safety is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-521(2): This section does not prohibit restoration by the owner of the name of the maker, model, or of the original manufacturer's number or other mark of identification when the restoration is authorized by the Department of Public Safety, nor prevent any manufacturer from placing in the ordinary course of business the name of the make, model, manufacturer's number, or other mark of identification upon a new pistol or revolver.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-522 Alteration of number or mark on pistol or revolver.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any person who changes, alters, removes, or obliterates the name of the maker, the model, manufacturer's number, or other mark of identification, including any distinguishing number or mark assigned by the Department of Public Safety, on any pistol or revolver, without first having secured written permission from the Department of Public Safety to make the change, alteration, or removal, is guilty of a class A misdemeanor.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-523 Persons exempt from weapons laws.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-523(1): 76-10-506; 76-10-508; 76-10-508.1; Title 53, Chapter 5, Part 7, Concealed Firearm Act; 53-5-711; 53-5-711; 53-5-711 Except for Sections

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-523(1)(g): a common carrier while engaged in the regular and ordinary transport of firearms as merchandise.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-523(3): 76-10-504(1); (2); 76-10-505; 53-5-704; 78B-7-603(1)(b); 78B-7-404(1)(b); 76-10-503(1) Subsections
