Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(4)(b): An offense under this section committed by a person 16 or 17 years old is a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(4)(c): An offense under this section committed by a person younger than 16 years old is a class B misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(4)(d): (4)(a); 77-18-105 Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(5): (1); (2); (3); (4)(a) A person 18 years old or older who knowingly solicits, requests, commands, encourages, or intentionally aids another person younger than 18 years old to engage in conduct prohibited under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6): 76-10-1230; 76-10-1230
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(a): 76-10-1230 This section does not apply to an Internet service provider, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(a)(i): the distribution of pornographic material by the Internet service provider occurs only incidentally through the Internet service provider's function of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(a)(i)(A): transmitting or routing data from one person to another person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(a)(i)(B): providing a connection between one person and another person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(a)(ii): the Internet service provider does not intentionally aid or abet in the distribution of the pornographic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(a)(iii): the Internet service provider does not knowingly receive funds from or through a person who distributes the pornographic material in exchange for permitting the person to distribute the pornographic material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(b): 76-10-1230 This section does not apply to a hosting company, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(b)(i): the distribution of pornographic material by the hosting company occurs only incidentally through the hosting company's function of providing data storage space or data caching to a person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(b)(ii): the hosting company does not intentionally engage, aid, or abet in the distribution of the pornographic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204(6)(b)(iii): the hosting company does not knowingly receive funds from or through a person who distributes the pornographic material in exchange for permitting the person to distribute, store, or cache the pornographic material.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5 Reporting of child sexual abuse material by a computer technician.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(1): 76-5b-103 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(1)(a): 76-5b-103 "Child sexual abuse material" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(1)(b): "Computer technician" or "technician" means an individual who in the course and scope of the individual's employment for compensation installs, maintains, troubleshoots, upgrades, or repairs computer hardware, software, personal computer networks, or peripheral equipment.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(1)(c): "Image" means an image of child sexual abuse material or an image that a computer technician reasonably believes is child sexual abuse material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2): (3); (2)(a); (2)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(a): (3) A computer technician who in the course of employment for compensation views an image on a computer or other electronic device that is or appears to be child sexual abuse material shall immediately report the finding of the image to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(a)(i): a state or local law enforcement agency, or the Cyber Tip Line at the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(a)(ii): (3) an employee designated by the employer of the computer technician in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(b): (2)(a) A computer technician who willfully does not report an image as required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(c): The identity of the computer technician who reports an image shall be confidential, except as necessary for the criminal investigation and the judicial process.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(d): (2)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(d)(i): If the computer technician makes or does not make a report under this section in good faith, the technician is immune from any criminal or civil liability related to reporting or not reporting the image.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(d)(ii): (2)(d) In this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(2)(e): It is a defense to prosecution under this section that the computer technician did not report the image because the technician reasonably believed the image did not depict a person younger than 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(3): (2)(a); (2)(a)(i); (3)(a); (2)(d)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(3)(a): (2)(a); (2)(a)(i) An employer of a computer technician may implement a procedure that requires:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(3)(a)(i): (2)(a) the computer technician report an image as is required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(3)(a)(ii): (2)(a)(i) the designated employee to immediately forward the report provided by the computer technician to an agency under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(3)(b): (3)(a); (2)(d) Compliance by the computer technician and the designated employee with the reporting process under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1204.5(4): This section does not apply to an Internet service provider or interactive computer service, as defined in 47 U.S.C. Sec. 230(f)(2), a provider of an electronic communications service as defined in 18 U.S.C. Sec. 2510, a telecommunications service, information service, or mobile service as defined in 47 U.S.C. Sec. 153, including a commercial mobile service as defined in 47 U.S.C. Sec. 332(d), or a cable operator as defined in 47 U.S.C. Sec. 522, if the provider reports the image in compliance with 18 U.S.C. 2258A or a successor federal statute that requires reporting by a provider of an image of child sexual abuse material.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205 Inducing acceptance of pornographic material -- Exemptions for Internet service providers and hosting companies.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(1): A person is guilty of inducing acceptance of pornographic material when he knowingly:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(1)(a): requires or demands as a condition to a sale, allocation, consignment, or delivery for resale of any newspaper, magazine, periodical, book, publication, or other merchandise that the purchaser or consignee receive any pornographic material or material reasonably believed by the purchaser or consignee to be pornographic; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(1)(b): denies, revokes, or threatens to deny or revoke a franchise, or to impose any penalty, financial or otherwise, because of the failure or refusal to accept pornographic material or material reasonably believed by the purchaser or consignee to be pornographic.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(2): (2); 77-18-105
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(2)(a): An offense under this section is a third degree felony punishable by:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(2)(a)(i): a minimum mandatory fine of not less than $1,000 plus $10 for each article exhibited up to the maximum allowed by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(2)(a)(ii): incarceration, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than 30 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(2)(b): (2); 77-18-105 This Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3): 76-10-1230; 76-10-1230
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(a): 76-10-1230 This section does not apply to an Internet service provider, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(a)(i): the distribution of pornographic material by the Internet service provider occurs only incidentally through the Internet service provider's function of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(a)(i)(A): transmitting or routing data from one person to another person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(a)(i)(B): providing a connection between one person and another person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(a)(ii): the Internet service provider does not intentionally aid or abet in the distribution of the pornographic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(a)(iii): the Internet service provider does not knowingly receive funds from or through a person who distributes the pornographic material in exchange for permitting the person to distribute the pornographic material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(b): 76-10-1230 This section does not apply to a hosting company, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(b)(i): the distribution of pornographic material by the hosting company occurs only incidentally through the hosting company's function of providing data storage space or data caching to a person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(b)(ii): the hosting company does not intentionally engage, aid, or abet in the distribution of the pornographic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1205(3)(b)(iii): the hosting company does not knowingly receive funds from or through a person who distributes the pornographic material in exchange for permitting the person to distribute, store, or cache the pornographic material.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206 Dealing in material harmful to a minor -- Penalties -- Exemptions for Internet service providers and hosting companies.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(1): A person is guilty of dealing in material harmful to minors when, knowing or believing that an individual is a minor, or having negligently failed to determine the proper age of a minor, the person intentionally:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(1)(a): distributes or offers to distribute, or exhibits or offers to exhibit, to a minor or an individual whom the person believes to be a minor, any material harmful to minors;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(1)(b): produces, performs, or directs any performance, before a minor or an individual whom the person believes to be a minor, that is harmful to minors; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(1)(c): participates in any performance, before a minor or an individual whom the person believes to be a minor, that is harmful to minors.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2): (2)(b); (2)(a); 77-18-105
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2)(a): (2)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2)(a)(i): a minimum mandatory fine of not less than $1,000, plus $10 for each article exhibited up to the maximum allowed by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2)(a)(ii): incarceration, without suspension of sentence, for a term of not less than 14 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2)(b): Each separate offense under this section committed by a person 18 years old or older against a minor 16 years old or older, but younger than 18 years old, is a class A misdemeanor if the person is less than seven years older than the minor at the time of the offense.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2)(c): Each separate offense under this section committed by a person 16 or 17 years old is a class A misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2)(d): Each separate offense under this section committed by a person younger than 16 years old is a class B misdemeanor.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(2)(e): (2)(a); 77-18-105 Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3): (2)(b); (2)(b); (3)(a); 77-18-105; 76-10-1230; 76-10-1230
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(a): (2)(b) Except for a defendant described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(a)(i): a minimum mandatory fine of not less than $5,000, plus $10 for each article exhibited up to the maximum allowed by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(a)(ii): incarceration, without suspension of sentence, for a term of not less than one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(b): (2)(b) If a defendant described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(c): (3)(a); 77-18-105 Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d): 76-10-1230; 76-10-1230
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(i): 76-10-1230 This section does not apply to an Internet service provider, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(i)(A): the distribution of pornographic material by the Internet service provider occurs only incidentally through the provider's function of:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(i)(A)(I): transmitting or routing data from one person to another person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(i)(A)(II): providing a connection between one person and another person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(i)(B): the provider does not intentionally aid or abet in the distribution of the pornographic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(i)(C): the provider does not knowingly receive from or through a person who distributes the pornographic material a fee greater than the fee generally charged by the provider, as a specific condition for permitting the person to distribute the pornographic material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(ii): 76-10-1230 This section does not apply to a hosting company, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(ii)(A): the distribution of pornographic material by the hosting company occurs only incidentally through the hosting company's function of providing data storage space or data caching to a person;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(ii)(B): the hosting company does not intentionally engage, aid, or abet in the distribution of the pornographic material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(3)(d)(ii)(C): the hosting company does not knowingly receive from or through a person who distributes the pornographic material a fee greater than the fee generally charged by the provider, as a specific condition for permitting the person to distribute, store, or cache the pornographic material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(4): 76-10-1230; 76-10-1231 A service provider, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1206(5): (1); (2)(a) A person 18 years old or older who knowingly solicits, requests, commands, encourages, or intentionally aids another person younger than 18 years old to engage in conduct in violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1207 Use of real property by tenant or occupant -- Voiding of lease -- Allowance of such use by owner or lessor.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1207(1): If a tenant or occupant of real property uses this property for an activity for which he or his employee is convicted under any provision of this part, the conviction makes void the lease or other title under which he holds at the option of the fee owner or any intermediate lessor; and 10 days after the fee owner or any intermediate lessor gives notice in writing to the tenant or occupant that he is exercising the option, the right of possession to the property reverts in the person exercising the option. This option does not arise until all avenues of direct appeal from the conviction have been exhausted or abandoned by the tenant or occupant, or his employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1207(2): (2); (1); (2); (2) It shall be unlawful for a fee owner or intermediate lessor of real property to knowingly allow this property to be used for the purpose of distributing or exhibiting pornographic materials, or for pornographic performances, by a tenant or occupant if the tenant or occupant, or his employee, has been convicted under any provision of this part of an offense occurring on the same property and all avenues of direct appeal from the conviction have been exhausted or abandoned.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1207(2)(a): (2); (1); (2) "Allow" under this subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1207(2)(b): (2) A willful violation of this subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1207(3): (1) Any tenant or occupant who receives a notice in writing that the fee owner or intermediate lessor is exercising the option provided by subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1207.5 Exemption -- Corrections treatment, programs.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This part does not apply to the Department of Corrections or any treatment program by or under contract with the department when the use of sexually explicit material that is pornographic is limited to the assessment or treatment of an offender as defined under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1208 Affirmative defenses.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1208(1): It is an affirmative defense to prosecution under this part that the distribution of pornographic material is restricted to institutions or persons having scientific, educational, governmental, or other similar justification for possessing pornographic material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1208(2): It is not a defense to prosecution under this part that the actor is a motion picture projectionist, usher, ticket-taker, bookstore employee, or otherwise is required to violate this part incident to the person's employment.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1208(3): 76-10-1206; 76-10-1227; 76-10-1228 It is an affirmative defense to prosecution under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1208(3)(a): in a sealed opaque wrapper that covers at least the lower 2/3 of the material so that the lower 2/3 of the material is concealed from view;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1208(3)(b): placed behind a blinder rack; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1208(3)(c): displayed in an area from which a minor is physically excluded if the material cannot be viewed by the minor from an area in which a minor is allowed.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1209 Injunctive relief -- Jurisdiction -- Consent to be sued.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1209(1): The district courts of this state shall have full power, authority, and jurisdiction, upon application by any county attorney or city attorney within their respective jurisdictions or the attorney general, to issue any and all proper restraining orders, preliminary and permanent injunctions, and any other writs and processes appropriate to carry out and enforce the provisions of this part.  No restraining order or injunction, however, shall issue except upon notice to the person sought to be enjoined.  That person shall be entitled to a trial of the issues commencing within three days after filing of an answer to the complaint and a decision shall be rendered by the court within two days after the conclusion of the trial.  If a final order or judgment of injunction is entered against the person sought to be enjoined, this final order or judgment shall contain a provision directing the person to surrender to the sheriff of the county in which the action was brought any pornographic material in the person's possession which is subject to the injunction; and the sheriff shall be directed to seize and destroy this material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1209(2): Any person not qualified to do business in the state who sends or brings any pornographic material into the state with the intent to distribute or exhibit it to others in this state consents that the person may be sued in any proceedings commenced under this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210 Relation to other laws.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1)(a): It is not the intent of this part to prescribe or limit the regulation of pornographic materials or materials harmful to minors, and counties, cities, and other political subdivisions are specifically given the right to further regulate the materials.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1)(b): Without limitation, a political subdivision may further regulate materials by ordinances relating to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1)(b)(i): zoning;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1)(b)(ii): licensing;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1)(b)(iii): public nuisances;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1)(b)(iv): a specific type of business such as adult bookstores or drive-in movies; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(1)(b)(v): use of blinder racks.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(2): 76-10-803; 76-10-806 It is not the intent of this part to preclude the application of other laws of this state to pornographic materials or materials harmful to minors. Specifically, without limitation, this part is not in derogation of Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1210(3): 76-10-803; 76-10-803 The commission of a crime under this part shall be considered to offend public decency under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1211 Severability clause.
-----------------------------------------------------
If any clause, sentence, paragraph, or part of this part or its application to any person or circumstance shall for any reason be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, the judgment shall not affect, impair, or invalidate the remainder of this part or its application to other persons or circumstances but shall be confined in its operation to the clause, sentence, paragraph, persons, or circumstances, or part thereof directly involved in the controversy in which the judgment shall have been rendered.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212 Search and seizure -- Affidavit -- Issuance of warrant -- Hearing upon claim that material seized not pornographic or harmful to minors -- Procedures cumulative.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(1): An affidavit for a search warrant shall be filed with the magistrate describing with specificity the material sought to be seized. Where practical, the material alleged to be pornographic or harmful to minors shall be attached to the affidavit for search warrant to afford the magistrate the opportunity to examine this material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(2): Upon the filing of an affidavit for a search warrant, the magistrate shall determine, by examination of the material sought to be seized if attached, by examination of the affidavit describing the material, or by other manner or means that he finds necessary, whether probable cause exists to believe that the material is pornographic or harmful to minors and whether probable cause exists for the immediate issuance of a search warrant. Upon making this determination, he shall issue a search warrant ordering the seizure of the material described in the affidavit for a search warrant according to the provisions of the Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(3)(a): If a search warrant is issued and material alleged to be pornographic or harmful to minors is seized under the provisions of this section, any person claiming to be in possession of this material or claiming ownership of it at the time of its seizure may file a notice in writing with the magistrate within 10 days after the date of the seizure, alleging that the material is not pornographic or harmful to minors.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(3)(b): The magistrate shall set a hearing within seven days after the filing of this notice, or at another time to which the claimant might agree. At this hearing evidence may be presented as to whether there is probable cause to believe the material seized is pornographic or harmful to minors, and at the conclusion of the hearing the magistrate shall make a further determination of whether probable cause exists to believe that the material is pornographic or harmful to minors.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(3)(c): A decision as to whether there is probable cause to believe the seized material is pornographic or harmful to minors shall be rendered by the court within two days after the conclusion of the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(3)(d): If at the hearing the magistrate finds that no probable cause exists to believe that the material is pornographic or harmful to minors, then the material shall be returned to the person or persons from whom it was seized.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(3)(e): If the material seized is a film, and the claimant demonstrates that no other copy of the film is available to him, the court shall allow the film to be copied at the claimant's expense pending the hearing.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(4): If a motion to suppress the evidence is granted on the grounds of an unlawful seizure, the property shall be restored unless it is subject to confiscation as contraband, in which case it may not be returned.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(5)(a): Procedures under this section for the seizure of allegedly pornographic material or material harmful to minors are cumulative of all other lawful means of obtaining evidence as provided by the laws of this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1212(5)(b): This section does not prevent the obtaining of allegedly pornographic material or material harmful to minors by purchase, subpoena duces tecum, or under injunction proceedings as authorized by this act or by any other provision of law of the state.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1213 Corporate defendants -- Summons -- Subpoena duces tecum.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1213(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1213(1)(a): The attendance in court of a corporation for purposes of commencing or prosecuting a criminal action against it under this part may be accomplished by the issuance and service of a summons. A summons shall be issued by a magistrate if he finds probable cause that material in the possession of the corporation against which the summons is sought is pornographic or harmful to minors, which finding shall be upon affidavit describing with specificity the material alleged to be pornographic or harmful to minors or by another manner or means the magistrate finds necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1213(1)(b): Where practical, the material alleged to be pornographic or harmful to minors shall be attached to the affidavit so as to afford the magistrate the opportunity to examine this material.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1213(1)(c): The summons must be served upon the corporation by delivery of it to an officer, director, managing or general agent, or cashier, or assistant cashier of the corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1213(2): The production of material alleged to be pornographic or harmful to minors in any proceedings under this part against a corporation may be compelled by the issuance and service of a subpoena duces tecum. This section does not prohibit or limit the use of a subpoena duces tecum in proceedings against natural persons under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1214 Conspiracy -- Punishment.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1214(1): 77-18-105
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1214(1)(a): A conspiracy of two or more persons to commit any offense proscribed by this part is a third degree felony  punishable for each separate offense by a minimum mandatory fine of not less than $1,000 and by imprisonment, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than 60 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1214(1)(b): 77-18-105 This subsection supersedes Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1214(2): 77-18-105
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1214(2)(a): If a defendant has already been convicted once under this section, each separate further offense is a second degree felony punishable by a minimum mandatory fine of not less than $5,000 and by imprisonment, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than one year.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1214(2)(b): 77-18-105 This subsection supersedes Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1215 Prosecution by county, district, or city attorney -- Fines payable to county or city.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Prosecution for violation of any section of this part, including a felony violation, shall be brought by the county attorney or, if within a prosecution district, the district attorney of the county where the violation occurs.  If the violation occurs, however, in a city of the first or second class, prosecution may be brought by either the county, district, or city attorney, notwithstanding any provision of law limiting the powers of city attorneys.  All fines imposed for the violation of this part shall be paid to the county or city of the prosecuting attorney, as the case may be.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1216 Distribution of motion picture films -- Definitions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
As used in this act:Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1216(1): "Exhibit" means to show in a public place or in a place where the public is admitted, whether or not an admission fee is charged.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1216(2): "Distributor" means any person from which a film is acquired by sale, lease, loan, or any other means, directly or indirectly, for the purpose of exhibiting it in this state or elsewhere but shall not include any person whose function with respect to any film is limited to the transportation or storage thereof.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1216(3): "Film" means what is usually known as a motion picture film and which is intended to be shown commercially for profit by devices of any kind whatsoever.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1216(4): "Person" includes a natural person, firm, association, partnership, or corporation.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1216(5): "Public place" includes any place to which admission is gained by payment of a membership or admission fee, however designated, notwithstanding it is designated as a private club or by words of like import.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1217 Intent to prevent commercial distribution and exhibition of pornographic films--Local regulation and other laws not limited.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1217(1): It is the intent of this act to prevent the commercial distribution and exhibition of films in this state which are pornographic.  There is substantial evidence that elements of organized crime have engaged to an increasing degree in the production and distribution of such films and, therefore, it is the further intent of this act to facilitate the criminal prosecution of distributors of pornographic films.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1217(2): Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 12, Pornographic and Harmful Materials and Performances It is not the intent of this act to limit the regulation of films by counties, cities, towns, and other political subdivisions within the state, and these subdivisions are specifically given the right by this act to further regulate films.  Nor is it the intent of this act to limit or abridge the power to otherwise prosecute violations of any other provisions of law including, but not limited to, those provisions of


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1218 Qualification for exhibition and distribution of films required.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
No person shall distribute any film for exhibition in this state unless that person is first qualified to do so nor exhibit any film in this state which was not acquired for exhibition, directly or indirectly, from a distributor qualified to distribute films in this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219 Qualification for distribution of films.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219(1): A distributor which is a corporation shall be qualified to distribute films within this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219(1)(a): it is a domestic corporation in good standing or a foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219(1)(b): it submits itself to the jurisdiction and laws of this state relating to being a distributor in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219(2): A distributor which is not a corporation shall be qualified to distribute films within this state if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219(2)(a): it has and continuously maintains a registered office in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219(2)(b): it has a registered agent whose business address is at that registered office and which is either an individual residing and domiciled in this state, a domestic corporation in good standing, or a foreign corporation authorized to transact business in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1219(3): This section shall not affect the right to serve any process, notice, or demand, required or permitted by law to be served upon a distributor, in any other manner provided by law.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1220 Change of registered office or agent by film distributor.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A distributor qualified to distribute films in this state may change its registered office or registered agent in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1221 Service of process, notice, or demand on registered agent of film distributor.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Any process, notice, or demand required or permitted by law to be served upon the distributor may be served upon the registered agent of that distributor.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1222 Distribution of pornographic film -- Penalties for violations.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1222(1): Any person who knowingly or by criminal negligence distributes for exhibition within this state a film which is pornographic as that term is defined in the Utah criminal code shall be guilty of a class A misdemeanor and shall, for each separate offense, be fined not less than $1,000 and imprisoned, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than 60 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1222(2): Any person convicted of a violation of this section who has been convicted before of a violation of this section, shall be guilty of a felony of the third degree and shall, for each separate offense, be fined not less than $5,000 and imprisoned, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than six months.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1222(3): Each copy of a pornographic film distributed for exhibition within this state in violation of this section shall constitute a separate offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1223 Distribution of film without being qualified -- Exhibition of film not acquired from qualified distributor -- Penalties for violations.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1223(1): Any person who knowingly distributes any film for exhibition within this state without being qualified to do so, or who knowingly exhibits a film in this state which has not been acquired from a distributor qualified to distribute films in this state is guilty of a class B misdemeanor and shall, for each separate offense, be fined not less than $299 and imprisoned, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than 30 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1223(2): Any person convicted of a violation of this section, who has been convicted before of a violation of this section, shall be guilty of a class A misdemeanor and shall, for each separate offense, be fined not less than $1,000 and imprisoned, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than 60 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1223(3): Each day's exhibition of such a film, and each copy of a film distributed for exhibition within this state, shall constitute a separate offense.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1224 Defense to prosecution for distribution or exhibition of pornographic film -- Status as projectionist or other employee no defense.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1224(1): 76-10-1222; 76-10-1223; 76-10-1226 It shall be an affirmative defense to any prosecution under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1224(2): 76-10-1222; 76-10-1223 It shall not constitute a defense to any prosecution under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1225 Prosecution of pornographic film violations by county attorney, district attorney, or city attorney.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The county attorney of the county where the violation occurred or within a prosecution district where the violation occurred, the district attorney shall file and prosecute any action for violations of this act unless the violation occurs in a city of the first or second class.  If the violation occurs in such a city, the action may be commenced and prosecuted by either the city attorney or the county attorney.  All fines imposed for any violation of this act shall be paid to the political subdivision employing the prosecuting attorney.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1226 Exemptions from application of film distribution act.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This part does not apply to any film:Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1226(1): distributed to or exhibited by any accredited university, college, school, library, or other educational institution, church, or museum, if there is scientific, religious, or educational justification for the exhibition of the film; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1226(2): 64-13-1 exhibited by the Department of Corrections or exhibited as part of any treatment program operated by or under contract with the department if the exhibition of the film is solely for the assessment or treatment of an offender as defined under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227 Indecent public displays -- Definitions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1): 76-10-1228 For purposes of this section and Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(a): "Description or depiction of illicit sex or sexual immorality" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(a)(i): human genitals in a state of sexual stimulation or arousal;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(a)(ii): acts of human masturbation, sexual intercourse, or sodomy;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(a)(iii): fondling or other erotic touching of human genitals or pubic region; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(a)(iv): fondling or other erotic touching of the human buttock or female breast.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(b): "Nude or partially denuded figure" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(b)(i): less than completely and opaquely covering human:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(b)(i)(A): genitals;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(b)(i)(B): pubic regions;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(b)(i)(C): buttock; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(b)(i)(D): female breast below a point immediately above the top of the areola; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(1)(b)(ii): human male genitals in a discernibly turgid state, even if completely and opaquely covered.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(2): (2)(c); 76-10-1228; (2)(a); (1)(a)(i); (ii); (iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(2)(a): (2)(c); 76-10-1228 Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(2)(b): (2)(a) As used in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1227(2)(c): (1)(a)(i); (ii); (iii) A description or depiction of illicit sex or sexual immorality as defined in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228 Indecent public displays -- Prohibitions -- Penalty.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(1): 76-10-1208(3) Subject to the affirmative defense in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(1)(a): engages in the business of selling, lending, giving away, showing, advertising for sale, or distributing to a minor or has in the person's possession with intent to engage in that business or to otherwise offer for sale or commercial distribution to a minor any material with:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(1)(a)(i): a description or depiction of illicit sex or sexual immorality; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(1)(a)(ii): a nude or partially denuded figure; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(1)(b): publicly displays at newsstands or any other establishment frequented by minors, or where the minors are or may be invited as a part of the general public, any motion picture, or any live, taped, or recorded performance, or any still picture or photograph, or any book, pocket book, pamphlet, or magazine the cover or content of which:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(1)(b)(i): exploits, is devoted to, or is principally made up of one or more descriptions or depictions of illicit sex or sexual immorality; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(1)(b)(ii): consists of one or more pictures of nude or partially denuded figures.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(2): 77-18-105
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(2)(a): A violation of this section is punishable by:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(2)(a)(i): a minimum mandatory fine of not less than $500; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(2)(a)(ii): incarceration, without suspension of sentence in any way, for a term of not less than 30 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1228(2)(b): 77-18-105 This section supersedes Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1229.5 Breast feeding is not violation of this part.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A woman's breast feeding, including breast feeding in any location where the woman otherwise may rightfully  be, does not under any circumstance constitute a violation of this part, irrespective of whether or not the breast is covered during or incidental to feeding.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(1): "Consumer" means an individual residing in this state who subscribes to a service provided by a service provider for personal or residential use.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(2): "Content provider" means a person domiciled in Utah or that generates or hosts content in Utah, and that creates, collects, acquires, or organizes electronic data for electronic delivery to a consumer with the intent of making a profit.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(3): (2)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(3)(a): "Hosting company" means a person that provides services or facilities for storing or distributing content over the Internet without editorial or creative alteration of the content.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(3)(b): (2) A hosting company may have policies concerning acceptable use without becoming a content provider under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(4): "Internet service provider" means a person engaged in the business of providing broadband Internet access service, with the intent of making a profit, to consumers in Utah.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(5): "Properly rated" means content using a labeling system to label material harmful to minors provided by the content provider in a way that:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(5)(a): accurately apprises a consumer of the presence of material harmful to minors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(5)(b): allows the consumer the ability to control access to material harmful to minors based on the material's rating by use of reasonably priced commercially available software, including software in the public domain.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(6): "Restrict" means to limit access to material harmful to minors by:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(6)(a): properly rating content; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(6)(b): any other reasonable measures feasible under available technology.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(7): (7)(b); (7)(b); (7)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(7)(a): (7)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(7)(b): "Service provider" does not include a person who does not terminate a service in this state, but merely transmits data through:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(7)(b)(i): a wire;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(7)(b)(ii): a cable; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(7)(b)(iii): an antenna.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1230(7)(c): (7)(b); (7)(a) "Service provider," notwithstanding Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231 Data service providers -- Internet content harmful to minors.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(1): (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(1)(a): Upon request by a consumer, a service provider shall filter content to prevent the transmission of material harmful to minors to the consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(1)(b): (1)(a) A service provider complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(1)(c): (1)(a) At the time of a consumer's subscription to a service provider's service, the service provider shall notify the consumer in a conspicuous manner that the consumer may request to have material harmful to minors blocked under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(2): (1)(a); (2)(a); (2)(b) The Division of Consumer Protection within the Department of Commerce shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(2)(a): (1)(a) every other year request from each service provider information on how the service provider complies with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(2)(b): (2)(a) publish on the division's website a compilation of the information the division receives under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(2)(c): (2)(b) update the compilation described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(3)(b): (1)(a) A service provider may comply with Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1231(4)(b): (5) notify the service provider that the service provider has 90 days to comply with the provision being violated or be subject to Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233 Content providers -- Material harmful to minors.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233(1): A content provider that is domiciled in Utah, or generates or hosts content in Utah, shall restrict access to material harmful to minors.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233(2): (1); (1); (1); (3) If the attorney general determines that a content provider violates Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233(2)(a): (1) notify the content provider that the content provider is in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233(2)(b): (1); (3) notify the content provider that the content provider has 30 days to comply with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233(3): (2); (1)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233(3)(a): (2); (1) If a content provider intentionally or knowingly violates this section more than 30 days after receiving the notice provided under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1233(3)(b): A proceeding to impose the civil fine under this section may be brought only by the state attorney general and shall be brought in a court of competent jurisdiction.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1234 Rulemaking authority.
------------------------------------------------------
The Division of Consumer Protection shall make rules in accordance with

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235 Accessing pornographic or indecent material on school property.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(1): 76-10-1201; 76-10-1203; 76-10-1227 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(1)(a): 76-10-1201; 76-10-1203; 76-10-1227 "Pornographic or indecent material" means any material:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(1)(a)(i): 76-10-1201 defined as harmful to minors in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(1)(a)(ii): 76-10-1203 described as pornographic in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(1)(a)(iii): 76-10-1227 described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(1)(b): "School property" means property, including land and improvements, that a school district or charter school owns, leases, or occupies.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(2): (3); 76-10-1204; 76-10-1205; 76-10-1206; 76-10-1228 Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(2)(a): 76-10-1204 distributing pornographic material as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(2)(b): 76-10-1205 inducing acceptance of pornographic material as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(2)(c): 76-10-1206 dealing in material harmful to a minor as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(2)(d): 76-10-1228 indecent public displays as specified in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(3): This section does not apply to school or law enforcement personnel when the access to pornographic or indecent material on school property is limited to:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(3)(a): investigation of a violation of this section; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(3)(b): enforcement of this section.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(4): Each separate offense under this section is:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(4)(a): a class A misdemeanor if the person is 18 years of age or older; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(4)(b): a class B misdemeanor if the person is under 18 years of age.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1235(5): This section does not prohibit disciplinary action for actions that violate this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1236 Possession of a child sex doll -- Penalties.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1236(1): As used in this section, "child sex doll" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1236(1)(a): an anatomically correct doll, mannequin, or robot, with the features of, or with features that resemble those of, a minor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1236(1)(b): is intended for use in sexual acts.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1236(2): An actor commits the offense of possession of a child sex doll if the actor knowingly or intentionally possesses a child sex doll.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1236(3): (2) A violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1237 Distributing or purchasing a child sex doll -- Penalties.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1237(1): 76-10-1236 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1237(1)(a): 76-10-1236 "Child sex doll" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1237(1)(b): "Distribute" means to sell, or with or without consideration, offer to sell, advertise, provide, ship, deliver for shipment, offer to deliver for shipment, or transfer.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1237(2): An actor commits the offense of distributing or purchasing a child sex doll if the actor knowingly, intentionally, or recklessly distributes, purchases, or offers to purchase a child sex doll.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1237(3): (2) A violation of Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this part:Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301(1): "Child" is an individual younger than 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301(2): "Place of prostitution" means a place or business where prostitution or promotion of prostitution is arranged, regularly carried on, or attempted by one or more individuals under the control, management, or supervision of another.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301(3): 76-10-1302(1); 76-10-1313(1)(a); (c); (d); (f) "Prostitute" or "prostituted individual" means an individual engaged in an activity described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301(4): "Public place" means a place to which the public or any substantial group of the public has access.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301(5): "Sexual activity" means, regardless of the gender of either participant:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301(5)(a): an act of masturbation, sexual intercourse, or any sexual act involving the genitals of one individual and the mouth or anus of another individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1301(5)(b): the touching of the genitals, female breast, or anus of one individual with any other body part of another individual with the intent to sexually arouse or gratify either individual.

----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1302(1): 76-10-1315 An actor, except for a child under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303 Patronizing a prostitute.
----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(1): An actor is guilty of patronizing a prostitute if the actor:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(1)(a): pays or offers or agrees to pay a prostituted individual, or an individual the actor believes to be a prostituted individual, a fee, or the functional equivalent of a fee, for the purpose of engaging in an act of sexual activity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(1)(b): enters or remains in a place of prostitution for the purpose of engaging in sexual activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(2): (3); (4); (5); 76-10-1309 Patronizing a prostitute is a class A misdemeanor, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(3): 76-10-1307 A violation of this section that is preceded by a conviction under this section or a conviction under a local ordinance adopted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(4): 76-10-1307 A third violation of this section or a local ordinance adopted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(5): (5)(d); (1)(a); (1)(a); 76-2-304.5(5)(a); (5)(a); (5)(a); (5)(a); (5)(a); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(5)(a): (5)(d); (1)(a); (1)(a) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(5)(b): 76-2-304.5(5)(a); (5)(a) In accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(5)(c): (5)(a) An actor's belief that the individual was under 18 years old at the time of the offense, even if the individual was 18 years old or older, is a violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(5)(d): (5)(a); (5)(a); (5) If the act committed under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(6): Upon a conviction for a violation of this section, the court shall order:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(6)(a): the maximum fine amount and may not waive or suspend the fine; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1303(6)(b): the defendant to pay for and complete a court-approved educational program about the negative effects on an individual involved with prostitution or human trafficking.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304 Aiding prostitution.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(1): (1)(a); (1)(a); (1)(a) An individual is guilty of aiding prostitution if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(1)(a): (1)(a); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(1)(a)(i): solicits an individual to patronize a prostitute, or to patronize an individual the actor believes to be a prostitute;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(1)(a)(ii): procures or attempts to procure a prostitute, or an individual the actor believes to be a prostitute, for a patron;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(1)(a)(iii): leases, operates, or otherwise permits a place controlled by the actor, alone or in association with another, to be used for prostitution or the promotion of prostitution; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(1)(a)(iv): (1)(a); (1)(a) provides any service or commits any act that enables another individual to commit a violation of this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(1)(b): (1)(a) solicits, receives, or agrees to receive any benefit for committing any of the acts prohibited by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(2): (3) Aiding prostitution is a class A misdemeanor, except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(3): 76-10-1307 An individual who is convicted a second time, and on all subsequent convictions, under this section or under a local ordinance adopted in compliance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1304(4): Upon a conviction for a violation of this section, the court shall order the maximum fine amount and may not waive or suspend the fine.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305 Exploiting prostitution.
---------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(1): An individual is guilty of exploiting prostitution if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(1)(a): procures an individual for a place of prostitution;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(1)(b): encourages, induces, or otherwise purposely causes another to become or remain a prostitute;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(1)(c): transports an individual into or within this state with a purpose to promote that individual's engaging in prostitution or procuring or paying for transportation with that purpose;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(1)(d): not being a child or legal dependent of a prostitute, shares the proceeds of prostitution with a prostitute, or an individual the actor believes to be a prostitute, pursuant to their understanding that the actor is to share therein; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(1)(e): owns, controls, manages, supervises, or otherwise keeps, alone or in association with another, a place of prostitution or a business where prostitution occurs or is arranged, encouraged, supported, or promoted.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(2): Exploiting prostitution is a felony of the third degree.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1305(3): Upon a conviction for a violation of this section, the court shall order the maximum fine amount and may not waive or suspend the fine.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306 Aggravated exploitation of prostitution.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306(1): 76-10-1305; 76-10-1305; 76-5-308; 76-5-308.1; 76-5-308.3; 76-5-308.5 A person is guilty of aggravated exploitation if:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306(1)(a): 76-10-1305 in committing an act of exploiting prostitution, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306(1)(b): the person procured, transported, or persuaded or with whom the person shares the proceeds of prostitution is a child or is the spouse of the actor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306(1)(c): 76-10-1305; 76-5-308; 76-5-308.1; 76-5-308.3; 76-5-308.5 in the course of committing exploitation of prostitution, a violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306(2): (3) Aggravated exploitation of prostitution is a second degree felony, except under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306(3): Aggravated exploitation of prostitution involving a child is a first degree felony.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1306(4): Upon a conviction for a violation of this section, the court shall order the maximum fine amount and may not waive or suspend the fine.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1307 Local ordinance consistent with code provisions.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An ordinance adopted by a local authority governing prostitution or aiding prostitution shall be consistent with the provisions of this part which govern those matters.

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1308 Prosecution.
---------------------------------------------
The following class A misdemeanors may be prosecuted by attorneys of cities and towns, as well as by prosecutors authorized elsewhere in this code to prosecute these alleged violations:Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1308(1): 76-10-1302 class A misdemeanor violations of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1308(2): 76-10-1304 class A misdemeanor violations of Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1309 Enhanced penalties -- HIV positive offender.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A person who is convicted of prostitution under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 76-10-1309(1): has actual knowledge of the fact; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1309(2): 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313 has previously been convicted under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(1): "HIV infection" means an indication of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) infection determined by current medical standards and detected by any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(1)(a): presence of antibodies to HIV, verified by a positive confirmatory test, such as Western blot or other method approved by the Utah State Health Laboratory.  Western blot interpretation will be based on criteria currently recommended by the Association of State and Territorial Public Health Laboratory Directors;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(1)(b): presence of HIV antigen;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(1)(c): isolation of HIV; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(1)(d): demonstration of HIV proviral DNA.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(2): (1) "HIV positive individual" means a person who has an HIV infection as determined under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(3): 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313 "Local law enforcement agency" means the agency responsible for investigation of the violations of Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(4): (1) "Positive" means an indication of the HIV infection as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1310(5): "Test" or "testing" means a test or tests for HIV infection in accordance with standards recommended by the Department of Health.


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311 Mandatory testing -- Retention of offender medical file -- Civil liability.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(1): 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313 A person who has entered a plea of guilty, a plea of no contest, a plea of guilty with a mental condition, or been found guilty for violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(2): If the mandatory test has not been conducted prior to sentencing, and the convicted offender is already confined in a county jail or state prison, such person shall be tested while in confinement.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(3): (1) The local law enforcement agency shall cause the blood specimen of the offender as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(4): (1) The Department of Corrections shall cause the blood specimen of the offender defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(5): 76-10-1312 The local law enforcement agency shall collect and retain in the offender's medical file the following data:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(5)(a): the HIV infection test results;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(5)(b): 76-10-1312 a copy of the written notice as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(5)(c): photographic identification; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(5)(d): fingerprint identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(6): 63G-2-302(1)(b); 63G-2-304 The local law enforcement agency shall classify the medical file as a private record pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(7): The person tested shall be responsible for the costs of testing, unless the person is indigent.  The costs will then be paid by the local law enforcement agency or the Department of Corrections from the General Fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(8): 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313; 63G-2-202(1); 76-10-1309
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(8)(a): The laboratory performing testing shall report test results to only designated officials in the Department of Corrections, the Department of Health and Human Services, and the local law enforcement agency submitting the blood specimen.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(8)(b): Each department or agency shall designate those officials by written policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(8)(c): 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313; 63G-2-202(1); 76-10-1309 Designated officials may release information identifying an offender under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(9): 63G-7-202; 63G-2-801
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(9)(a): 63G-7-202 An employee of the local law enforcement agency, the Department of Corrections, or the Department of Health and Human Services who discloses the HIV test results under this section is not civilly liable except when disclosure constitutes fraud or willful misconduct as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(9)(b): 63G-2-801 An employee of the local law enforcement agency, the Department of Corrections, or the Department of Health and Human Services who discloses the HIV test results under this section is not civilly or criminally liable, except when disclosure constitutes a knowing violation of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1311(10): 63G-2-803 When the medical file is released as provided in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312 Notice to offender of HIV positive test results.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"A person who has been convicted of prostitution under SectionUtah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(1): 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313; (1) A person convicted under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(1)(a): the local law enforcement agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(1)(b): the Department of Corrections, for offenders confined in any state prison;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(1)(c): the state Department of Health and Human Services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(1)(d): (1) an authorized representative of any of the agencies listed in this Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(2): (1); 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313; 76-10-1309 The notice under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(2)(a): the date of the test;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(2)(b): the positive test results;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(2)(c): the name of the HIV positive individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(2)(d): 76-10-1302; 76-10-1303; 76-10-1313; 76-10-1309 the following language:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(3): Failure to provide this notice, or to provide the notice in the manner or form prescribed under this section, does not create any civil liability and does not create a defense to any prosecution under this part.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1312(4): 76-10-1309; Title 26B, Chapter 5, Health Care - Substance Use and Mental Health Upon conviction under Section


Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313 Sexual solicitation -- Penalty.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1): 76-10-1315; (1)(e)(i); (iv) An individual except for a child under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(a): offers or agrees to commit any sexual activity with another individual for a fee, or the functional equivalent of a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(b): pays or offers or agrees to pay a fee or the functional equivalent of a fee to another individual to commit any sexual activity;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(c): takes steps to arrange a meeting through any form of advertising or agreement to meet, and meets at an arranged place for the purpose of being hired to engage in sexual activity in exchange for a fee or the functional equivalent of a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(d): loiters in or within view of a public place for the purpose of being hired to engage in sexual activity in exchange for a fee, or the functional equivalent of a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(e): with intent to pay another individual to commit any sexual activity for a fee or the functional equivalent of a fee, requests or directs the other individual to engage in any of the following acts:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(e)(i): exposure of an individual's genitals, the buttocks, the anus, the pubic area, or the female breast below the top of the areola;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(e)(ii): masturbation;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(e)(iii): touching of an individual's genitals, the buttocks, the anus, the pubic area, or the female breast; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(e)(iv): any act of lewdness; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(1)(f): (1)(e)(i); (iv) with intent to engage in sexual activity for a fee, or the functional equivalent of a fee, engages in or offers or agrees to engage in an act described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(2): (1) An intent to engage in sexual activity for a fee may be inferred from an individual's engaging in, offering or agreeing to engage in, or requesting or directing another to engage in any of the acts described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(3): 76-10-1309; (4); (5); (1)(a); (c); (d); (f); 76-10-1307 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(3)(a): a class B misdemeanor on a first or second violation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(3)(b): a class A misdemeanor on a third or subsequent violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(4): 76-10-1309; (5); (8); (1)(b); (e); 76-10-1307 Except as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(4)(a): a class A misdemeanor on the first or second violation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(4)(b): a third degree felony on a third or subsequent violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(5): (1); 76-5-308; 76-5-308.1; 76-5-308.5; 76-5-308; 76-5-310; 76-5-310.1 If an individual commits an act of sexual solicitation in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(5)(a): 76-5-308; 76-5-308.1; 76-5-308.5; 76-5-308 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(5)(b): 76-5-310; 76-5-310.1 Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(6): 76-10-1315(2)
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(6)(a): 76-10-1315(2) Upon encountering a child engaged in commercial sex or sexual solicitation, a law enforcement officer shall follow the procedure described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(6)(b): A child engaged in commercial sex or sexual solicitation shall be referred to the Division of Child and Family Services for services and may not be subjected to delinquency proceedings.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1313(7): (1); (1); 76-10-1302(3) A prosecutor may not prosecute an individual for a violation of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315 Safe harbor for children as victims in commercial sex or sexual solicitation.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1): 76-10-1313(1)(a); (c); (d); (f); 80-2-201; 80-1-102 As used in this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1)(a): "Child engaged in commercial sex" means a child who:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1)(a)(i): engages, offers, or agrees to engage in any sexual activity with another individual for a fee, or the functional equivalent of a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1)(a)(ii): takes steps in arranging a meeting through any form of advertising, agreeing to meet, and meeting at an arranged place for the purpose of sexual activity in exchange for a fee or the functional equivalent of a fee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1)(a)(iii): loiters in or within view of any public place for the purpose of being hired to engage in sexual activity.
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1)(b): 76-10-1313(1)(a); (c); (d); (f) "Child engaged in sexual solicitation" means a child who offers or agrees to commit or engage in any sexual activity with another person for a fee, or the functional equivalent of a fee, under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1)(c): 80-2-201 "Division" means the Division of Child and Family Services created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(1)(d): 80-1-102 "Juvenile receiving center" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(2): 76-5-308; 76-5-308.1; 76-5-308.5 Upon encountering a child engaged in commercial sex or sexual solicitation, a law enforcement officer shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(2)(a): 76-5-308; 76-5-308.1; 76-5-308.5 conduct an investigation regarding possible human trafficking of the child pursuant to Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(2)(b): refer the child to the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(2)(c): bring the child to a juvenile receiving center, if available; and
Utah Code Annotated § 76-10-1315(2)(d): contact the child's parent or guardian, if practicable.
